They gave me the address to send it to, said the "lens error" would be free of charge to fix. I included a letter with my contact info and what the problem was, as the Canon rep told me to do. I had my camera back from Canon in less than 1 week... Good as new!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for those times when you don't want to take along a DSLR
Reviews.Author: K. Stigler
Reviews.Content: amazing camera for times when you don't want to lug around a DSLR.I purchased this camera so that I could keep it in my backpack at work to take photos on short notice.  i typically carry around a DSLR, but this is nice in a pinch.  It shoots raw images and the quality is amazing.  I really, really like the fact that I have the ability to do manual settings and can use the control ring to focus or zoom or any number of other functions.

Reviews.Title: Fair Camera at a Fair Price
Reviews.Author: Ta Hover
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot S100 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle Optical, its a good camera for its range ! for me over 7 MP is not necessary anymore. but the 5x angle optical is an important feature

Reviews.Title: Amazon locker delivered
Reviews.Author: costume art
Reviews.Content: The camera is very good for the price and practical because of its small size, you can take it wherever you go just in the pocket. I picked up at the Amazon locker, it was great being able to have frequent updates of where the camera was and go to pick it up as soon as it arrived! GREAT!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point and Shoot Camera, but some durability concerns.
Reviews.Author: Christopher Klein
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon T4i but still have this point and shoot for convenience.  I am very impressed with the image quailty.  The aperture range in this camera is great for low-light and portrait pics and the optical zoom is rather impressive from a true point and shoot.  My only complaint on this camera is the build quailty.  Don't get me wrong, the camera is defintely nice-looking but I have had instances where the lens is stuck open then powering the camera off.  The pop-up flash also concerns me as there are a lot of moving parts and some of the convenience of being a pocket camera is offset by my durability concerns of the camera.I am also very impressed with the wide-angle shots this camera can take.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: sebastian
Reviews.Content: Best point and shoot camera I've ever own.  Feels solid and handles well.  It's a whole lot better than using my cellphone camera.

Reviews.Title: Decent pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Dagny
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a portable replacement for a dSLR a year ago and it has held up well. I love that it has manual adjustments and a RAW image option. I think the battery life is great. Movies shot with this camera are sharp and the sound is quite good. The only thing I'm not crazy about is that in the auto mode the colors can be a bit washed out.

Reviews.Title: Canon S100
Reviews.Author: T.O.
Reviews.Content: Excellent controls and results.  Custom selection provides suberb pictures.  Set up the custom for your all around photo work and forget it.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera but lousy battery life with gps on.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Lee
Reviews.Content: Canon always has great point and shoots. The s100 does not disappoint. Great and easy to use. Lots of options for the semi pro and basic operation for novice users. Battery life is great unless using the gps which seems to have been dropped with the newer versions.One problem is a batch of the s100 were made with faulty lens controls. But canon is repairing those cameras that get the "stuck lens" message for free as long as it falls within the serial numbers that were effected.All in all great point and shoot that replaces our dslr for quick daily use.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: Dani O
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I have had it for a year now and have nothing but great things to say. This is probably my fourth or fifth digital camera and it is by far the best. I get comments all the time on how great my pictures look. The colors are vibrant and you can blow them up to poster size with no loss in quality. The battery life is pretty good but I would always recommend an extra battery. It has great zoom too. The only draw back is that the flash pops up on the top. It is where you would want to put your finger so often gets covered when people take a picture for you. It is definitely worth the money if you plan on taking pictures often and want them to look nice. I've used it in the dark, in bright sunlight, with snow, with fireworks and everytime a perfect picture. I recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, lousy battery
Reviews.Author: Rsquare
Reviews.Content: I started out in digital photography with Canons, which I loved, but then deserted the marque for a point-and-shoot from Panasonic (smaller, cheaper) and a DSLR from Pentax (image stabilization on camera rather than buying it over again with each new lens).  Still happy with the Pentax, but the Panasonic's CCD turned out to be be a dust magnet, so after carefully comparing point-and-shoots with manual capabilities, I bought a refurbished S100.It felt good to return to Canon's practice of having the "no flash" setting on the five-way switch on the camera back rather than Panasonic's placement on the mode-selection dial.  Since I never, ever, want flash, Canon's way of doing things allows me to use all possible modes without ever having to experience unwanted flash.  All of the other things on which other reviewers have commented - sharp lens, easy-to use ring around the lens for certain key settings, bright LCD - make the camera enjoyable, and it travels with me wherever I got.But (and there is always a but) either my S100 is a battery eater, or the OEM 1120 mAh battery supplied with the camera is junk, because I ran completely through the fully-charged battery after taking a grand total of 33 shots (56.7MB of information recorded).  I've ordered some Wasabi batteries from Amazon (Wasabi Power Battery Charger PowerShot Wasabis performed better than the OEM batteries in my Panasonic) and we'll see if the problem is the battery or perhaps a short somewhere in the camera which is draining batteries prematurely.  This could be why the camera was returned for refurbishment, although generally I have had great luck with refurbished photographic products.  I note that a few other reviewers mention short battery life, but my sense is that they are talking about a dead battery after a day of shooting maybe 100 pictures, not 33 shots over a two-week period.Edit 10/27 - I recharged the battery and have just done about 60 more shots over a two-day period and the battery is still showing full.  My takeaway from this is that the battery will slowly drain if the camera is left unused, which may be why Canon tells you to "Remove and store the battery when you are not using the camera."  BTW, I also compared the S100 and my DSLR with a Sigma 18-200mm zoom by enlarging portions of shots taken at the same time from the same location, and the S100 is way sharper.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Happy Camper
Reviews.Content: Perfect videos, great shots, point and shoot perfect, using the program settings perfect. Shots are clear and perfect. Girl Friend has camera at work to shoot products.  easier to use then her $1,500 slr, and shots are good enough for Her products.  I really like this camera, so does my Girl friend, I guess I should consider buying another one

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot out there
Reviews.Author: R. McCuistian
Reviews.Content: I love the way that, on Manual mode, I can dial the aperture and shutter speed to create the perfect picture on the small screen before I ever pull the trigger - I own 2 of these now!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Compact Camera for the Professional Photographer
Reviews.Author: Francis Lee
Reviews.Content: This is the best point-and-shoot camera that can be a mini DSLR if you are an avid photographer. Perfect to carry around for casual use.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot S100 - A Great Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Computer Geek
Reviews.Content: I have used the Canon Powershot S100 for almost 2 years without a single error. It takes great pictures and is easyto use in various modes. Canon acknowledged a technical service issue with some of the lenses on models within certain serial number batches. I have one in the effected group but have had no issues. It is not a recall, just a service issue and if you have the error, the fix is free. I would not hesitate to buy this model. I have been satisfied with all of the 15 plus Canon cameras I have owned.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Howard Hull
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect pocket camera. Excellent image quality. Many options to satisfy all of your shooting requirements. Great little camera!

Reviews.Title: top quality point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Gallagher "bobbyC"
Reviews.Content: If you want a point and shoot for simple and sophisticated shooting t his should be on your Final list. Took it to India for three weeks and it's great.  Bought a Swiss Army belt case for it.You will not find any missing capabilities.  Even had gps for where you took pic.  Front lens had rotating ring for dusk control of Manual mode!Only used the recharger 2 time in 3 weeks with lots of flash used.I am an avid hobby  photographer. I enjoyed the sight and size so much I am swapping my heavy Canon 5D and lens for a Panasonic GX7... 3/4 system.You will not be disappointed in the S100 if you get it as Your P & S camera.Bob Gallagher

Reviews.Title: Shutter Malfunction repaired once under warranty, now again
Reviews.Author: Brad S.
Reviews.Content: Purchased the S100 in July 2012, and started experiencing a shutter malfunction where it basically wouldn't take a picture in any mode when pressing the button.  I was able to get it repaired under warranty in June 2013, but now it is doing it again and they are refusing to offer any warranty on their previous warranty work.  Canon is losing another lifelong customer.Edit: After much hassling I was able to get them to repair it again, but this time they said there would be NO WARRANTY ON THEIR OWN WORK.  Ridiculous.Update May 2014:  And now the lens error (just look it up, VERY common with this camera).  It is not in the serial number range of the recall, it's after, so they won't repair it.  They want $70 just to look at it.  LOL.  Done with Canon.  Forever.

Reviews.Title: The best compact camera I've ever used
Reviews.Author: A man a panama
Reviews.Content: This camera has SLR features packed in a tiny package.  Want to control shutter speed? You can. Aperture? No problem. How about shooting RAW? SUPPORTED!  The color tone is vivid and amazing.  The build quality is solid and durable. Is it a DSLR? Of course not.  But how about a camera with built in HDR mode as well as that miniaturization effect? Ok those novelties wear off.  But this camera really has just tons of cool features that you may love or never use.  You could shoot in Auto all the time, and you'll still get amazing pictures from a camera that fits easily in your pocket.Oh and the battery lasts. I haven't had to charge it more than once in a few days of casual shooting/video recording.My one gripe with this camera is the video is so unbelievably uncompressed. Then when I go to compress it, I lose color tone.  That has more to do with my reencoding software I think.  Would be nice if you could adjust the Q rate of the h264 encoder.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: wolftrax
Reviews.Content: It it almost impossible to take a bad picture with this camera.  Very easy to use as a point and shoot and still has enough capabilities if you want to shoot in manual mode.

Reviews.Title: It is my best friend
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: Really high quality and it is so comfortable to keep it every time I go walking. Thank you very much

Reviews.Title: Point and Shot
Reviews.Author: wilkins
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this camera to anyone. I am to not too camera savy, but this one takes the guess work away. As I learn more about it though, it also has the potential to become more high tech. It's the perfect type of point and shot camera. My kids run and move fast, but this camera captures them perfectly. It also picks up all the colors that I love. My other hand held cameras never seemed to do the scenery justice. It is a it pricey and I'm not a huge fan of the battery pack instead of single batteries, but I still love it!

Reviews.Title: Best Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Alex Szela
Reviews.Content: looking to learn more about cameras and was suggested this as a good point and shoot camera. Down-right awesome, takes amazing pictures and is fairly durable. Traveled to 6 countries with it and its still taking awesome photos. The battery life is amazing as well. I always had an extra battery and a 16G memory in there and never had an issue.

Reviews.Title: Canon OS S100
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Nepi "Mick45"
Reviews.Content: It is a reat camera but I wish that it came with a decent memory card and case, ot even an oprtion to buy these.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy
Reviews.Author: Peas
Reviews.Content: I bought it during Black Friday.  It was a steal.  I like the size and its GPS function.  The reason why I did not give it a 5 star is because it froze on me once and I had to delete all my photos for it to work again.

Reviews.Title: Finally got it
Reviews.Author: Track Guy
Reviews.Content: Been looking for this camera to be at a good price for some time.  Finally saw it an d picked it up.  A lot of flexibility with the controls, great pictures also.  Great travel camera

Reviews.Title: Good Camera!
Reviews.Author: Darren1
Reviews.Content: I love it it's got everything I need. It's easy to use. I just wanted something that has a AUTO function. Point and Shoot.

Reviews.Title: I Went Cruising with my Canon PowerShot Camera
Reviews.Author: Ronswife "Ronswife in PA"
Reviews.Content: I used my camera for the first time on my Caribbean Cruise. It took great pictures and video. It was very easy to set up the program to view and download my pictures to my computer. I love the size also. It fit easily in my pocketbook for quick access. I would definitely recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: power to shoot a'la professionals
Reviews.Author: Doris Nuval
Reviews.Content: this camera is the handiest pro-sumer (?) professional consumer product ever.  i've had nothing but kudos from people who've seen my shots taken with this camera.  sharp, clear and just perfect for its size.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Deederdun
Reviews.Content: Great camera with tons of features. Takes excellent pics.  The only drawback is the batteries die faster than my old cannon. I have 3 batteries and keep them all charged and packed just in case!

Reviews.Title: Best quality for a point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: nk12345
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a high-quality point-and-shoot to replace my Canon SD1000 pocket camera. This is a great substitute for a DSLR when you want something much more portable and for a lower price. The black color is stylish. I was most impressed by the wide-angle lens, video shooting quality, and low-light images. I rarely need the flash! This feature helps images stay true to color. This is also the first Canon camera I have had that has a battery indicator on it - it used to be all guesswork! That said, though, the battery icon stays forever at 3 bars, then once it goes to 2 bars it goes very quickly to zero. Better than nothing I suppose.One thing I found frustrating was that the wrist strap was next to impossible to put on the tiny and oddly angled loop on the camera body. Ultimately I had to link a loop of thread to the strap, attach the thread to a small piece of wire, and poke the wire and thread and strap into the loop on the camera body. It worked, but I wonder how that got past Canon's quality and design team.MAJOR SETBACK on this camera: Although I purchased a serial number much later than the ones with complaints of a "Lens Error," I got the dreaded "Lens Error"! One random day the camera lens stayed telescoped in the "out" position and the screen gave the "Lens Error" notice and automatically shut itself off and wouldn't power back on. I was traveling at the time, so it was challenging to transport a camera with the lens sticking out and totally unprotected. Fortunately I was covered by my warranty, so I sent it for repair - but did unfortunately have to pay for my own shipping to Canon. The biggest disappointment was that it was under repair in early July, so I didn't get to take the dazzling low-light photos I had hoped to for July 4th fireworks! And when I got the camera back from Canon, it had some new scuffs on it.I give it 4 stars because although I had some mishaps with the camera, they had nothing to do with the actual photography experience itself. I would buy this camera again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: What's not to like?
Reviews.Author: TomG
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for use in kite aerial photography.  However, it is so handy and does such a nice job that I find myself using it for most of my "ground" photography, too.  I shoot RAW as much as possible and have found that the Lightroom 4 RAW converter makes anything but "As shot" and "Auto" too yellow.  I don't know whether the fault lies with the camera, Lightroom 4 or myself.

Reviews.Title: Great camera that takes high quality pictures.
Reviews.Author: sunshine
Reviews.Content: I needed a small camera that I could carry in my purse for short trips and one that would take a high quality picture and this camera provided that for me.  It is easy to hold and filled my requirements.  I have received many compliments on the pictures I have taken.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Angela Barnhart
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera!  I love it!Very clear and takes great pictures, it's of good quality as well and the videos are great too.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot 100
Reviews.Author: Chris Jones
Reviews.Content: Until received, I didn't know what a great choice I made.  For its size, features are seemingly endless, but not intimidating. Most importantly, the photos are stunningly produced.  Pop up flash was a bit awkward, at first, but with time one adapts to it. Compared to list price, I don't think I could not have done better.  Don't use my SLR as ,much as I used to.  The S100 is so convenient ... wherever I go, it goes.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Peter Berglund
Reviews.Content: This must be the best point-and-shoot I have ever come in contact with!  I have no complaints at all and am so glad I bought it!

Reviews.Title: The best camera
Reviews.Author: Andras Vener
Reviews.Content: Thanks Canon,I tested more than 10 similar cameras and find this as the best. The sharpness and the pictures details are wonderfull

Reviews.Title: great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: oakpwr
Reviews.Content: I love my small cannon s80 and my wife needed a new camera so I bought her this for xmas.  Shoots fantastic pictures, lots of settings and is small and portable, she uses it all the time.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic photos!
Reviews.Author: cvggrrl
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional photographer and I'm not going to be the best person to talk about specs and pixels, etc., but this camera gives me really fantastic wide-angle photos with high quality clarity. This is one of the best purchases I've made in a long time!

Reviews.Title: Batteries.
Reviews.Author: Fabián Saúl Kleiman
Reviews.Content: I like this cámera.Light,pocketable,many options like a larger one,very good  pictures.Ideal for travel or surreptitious photography...BUT consumes the batteries with insatiable appetite.I always take with me 3 well charged batteries.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot S100 digital camera
Reviews.Author: WI gal
Reviews.Content: The quality of pictures is excellent.  There are many things on this camera that I have not mastered.  It really does more than I needed and would like to find someplace I could take lessons.  I don't have the patience to figure it out on my own.  It seems a little complicated for me.  I can only take photos and videos.  Can't understand the GPS on it.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: SeamusMcFamousMom
Reviews.Content: Had one of these before but now it's at the bottom of a lake (newbie kayaker), so wanted to get another one.Checked out serial number at Canon's website to verify it shouldn't have lense problems previously reported.  Like size, quality of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Susan H. Colby
Reviews.Content: Still getting used to a "down size" from my old one but I think I'm going to use this a lot more because of its portability.  Image quality is great and the unit is very user-friendly.

Reviews.Title: Canon S100 everyting you need in a compact camera
Reviews.Author: jd anderson
Reviews.Content: Great camera to start a new hobby. small enough to carry anywhere easily.  Very clear, sharp pictures.  Easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: this camera shocked me & every saw the photo of it  !
Reviews.Author: AbdulWahab
Reviews.Content: Actually this was my first camera I bought it last year;  all I know is how to power it on & off, zoom in & out,  I bought as a package with a 40M (130ft) camera case to enrol with under water course,  now you can see my photos in instagram @wahab66 everyone saw the photos was amazed from this compact camera  .It has one disadvantage one battery for one dive, so you need to have extra battery & you will be pleased. Few day's ago I bought a new camera as agift  & it was 16 Mega pixels. The old Canon is way better from the new _____ camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for travel.
Reviews.Author: Santhosh Sundararaman
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect option for travel, it's light, fits in a jean pocket and yet gives complete manual control with RAW shooting capabilities. Shoots well in low light as well. Took this on a recent travel and ended up not missing my 7D one bit and I don't think I'll pack my 7D for travel again - just too heavy and bulky.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Annjel Flax Solomon
Reviews.Content: I acquired this camera for my daughter for Christmas who has not put it down. It takes incredible pictures, with auto focus and the high mega-pixels reflect the high quality picture you get from this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love!
Reviews.Author: Smileyjo2
Reviews.Content: I enjoy the compact size of the Canon Powershot S100, the quality pictures both inside and outside, and the relative easiness in learning how to use the camera.

Reviews.Title: Love, Love, Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: Adam Aceto
Reviews.Content: This camera is light-years ahead of the one we had for the past 5 years. If you haven't purchased a new point-and-shoot in the past few years, don't even think about spending more money until you try this one out. Indoor low-light performance was important to me and I was not disappointed.  Auto is not always the best, so learn about some of the modes that best suit the conditions you find yourself in the most often. Couldn't be happier for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ilyapl
Reviews.Content: Takes awesome night pictures, even without the flash. Night mode makes the pictures even better.Camera is light with tons of functionality.

Reviews.Title: Love this product!
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I have 4 of these. Canon PowerShot S series are of great quality and value for money. They produce great pictures with small loss of quality as compared with DSLRs and at a fraction of the prices. I do underwater photography, and have invested quite a bomb on the housing, as such, I have purchased a number of spares for this model. I would also like to add that Andoroma (not sure if I have spell it right) delivers fast. I like their service.

Reviews.Title: Lens broken/Malfunction after one year use ...
Reviews.Author: adel
Reviews.Content: I love everything about the camera, fully satiisfed with it ... the only thing is that lens had in issue it was anounced by canon that its manufacturer defect. I had send for service, however, support here in the middle east sucks I was told to wait over a month for parts to arrive from Japan ....all in all this camera is one that wont regret buying if you are not looking for ZOOM cameras.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Luis Ayram
Reviews.Content: It is a very good product you can make a fantastisc photos, and is good for the sea with the underwater housing

Reviews.Title: I feel like a pro
Reviews.Author: Real Fakename
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. It click great pics. even in low light without flash.I have not got a very steady hand but this camera is pretty good in getting good shots easily.I just havnt figured out how to click panoramic pic. rest all the mode are fun and easy

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: EstoMax "estomax"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera on black Friday 9 months ago and it has worked great so far taking a few thousand pictures and videos. The camera does VERY well in low light conditions for being a fit-in-your-pocket camera. The GPS feature works OK, it does drain the battery faster though.

Reviews.Title: this camera is so worth it
Reviews.Author: interlec
Reviews.Content: bought this camera not knowing fully its capabilities and features but once i got it and started using it...wow!i would recommend this to anyone who is not big on photography and just like to see and take quality photos.

Reviews.Title: so much in such a little package
Reviews.Author: Lyn Moelich
Reviews.Content: I ask a friend whom I consider a pretty fine photographer to recommended a point and shoot, she immediately showed me her S100. I bought one on Amazon and I'm happy with my purchase.The image stabilization of this little camera is great. I'm still learning what the camera can do, but all my friends oouuued and aahed looking at my latest holiday pictures.

Reviews.Title: its is okay
Reviews.Author: Ke
Reviews.Content: it is ok the picture quality start going bad if you are shooting at iso 400 or higher. focus can be pretty bad sometime

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great pictures
Reviews.Author: Rob Hidalgo
Reviews.Content: These are the two things I would improve on this camera:1) Battery life2) Flash location (you hold the camera instinctively where the pop-up flash in located) first time users will prevent the flash from popping out because their fingers are on the way, over time I can imagine this could damage the pop-up flash.Other than those two items, this camera takes great pictures close to SLR cameras.  Great camera for the $

Reviews.Title: GPS inaccurate
Reviews.Author: bobby redford
Reviews.Content: took 29 pictures requiring GPS coordinates, only uploaded 17 when I got home.  very disappointing as it was work related.use an iOS app instead, save your money,

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: R. Thomas
Reviews.Content: I like the zoom range and fast lens. I prefer the color of the Canon S95, but then I still use a Canon S5 IS and get better low light images than from the S100, but it does not fit in a pocket. Bottom line, I like the Canon rendition of color, but prefer the old CCD sensors over the newer ones. The autofocus of the S100 is a bit slow, and the fill flash is random, sometimes great and sometimes awful. Given enough time you can get a great fill flash image, but usually not the first time.My favorite overall camera? The Fujifilm F100fd, it is the best pocket camera I have ever used. The colors are nicer than either the S100 or S95, it will autofocus in a flash and has the best full flash of any camera big or small that I have ever used, it is perfect each and every time. But the lens is slower and does not work as well at night.

Reviews.Title: What an awewsome dive camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Bruce V Gray
Reviews.Content: This camera exceeded the quality I was expecting for a camera priced at this amount. The dive was in 38 degree water and I filmed for a constant 23 minutes before the battery told me I needed to take a break.  I took another 44 pics after shutting of the video and after the dive, I was able to preview all the video and pics on the same battery!!!  I cannot complain about anything on this camera, it performed better than I could have ever expected.

Reviews.Title: Great for enthusiastic amateur
Reviews.Author: J. Palmer "bizbooksetc"
Reviews.Content: The minus is that the battery isn't that good--I've found it needs recharging after a day and a half of use or about 50-60 snaps. So buy a second battery!! Other than that I like the camera very much--it does all I need and does it well, quickly and simply.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Excellent value for the money
Reviews.Author: I_luv_gadgets
Reviews.Content: This is my handy-camera when I do not want to carry my DSLR around. I was amazed at the control and functions provided by this camera. The pictures are great when light is good. The pictures aren't too bad indoors as well as long as you have decent light. The camera is very light weight yet very customizable. I really enjoy using this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, not amazing
Reviews.Author: S. Schoenfield "newbie"
Reviews.Content: It's a quality point and shoot.I purchased this to have an auto point and shoot - not mess with manual settings. It does a great job. the lens popping up under where you put your finger is slightly annoying but not too big a deal.

Reviews.Title: Small but excellent image quality
Reviews.Author: Mr. C. Grice "4wd"
Reviews.Content: Especially if you are used to working with RAW, you can get outstanding results from this little thing.Looking through images at online sizes, it really is not easy to decide if they are from my 5D or the S100.Menu is not that easy to navigate, after 6 months I still sometimes have to look through everything to find some less used setting. Battery life is not bad if you turn off the GPS.Now available with substantial discounts it really is worth having.

Reviews.Title: Camera Cannon S100
Reviews.Author: Maria Beatriz Plaza
Reviews.Content: The pictures are excellent. It's easy to carry on. was the camera I was looking for. All Cannon products are great.

Reviews.Title: Great.
Reviews.Author: Joel Weiss
Reviews.Content: Ya the camera is great. so great that i have no words. really no words, not kidding. have a good day.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've Ever Owned.
Reviews.Author: K. Nyberg
Reviews.Content: I'm not a photo guru, I have mainly only used the AUTO setting of this camera.  Fully zooming and taking a picture still provided amazing detail and clarity.  I was super impressed and completely recommend Canon to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: Excellent with Night photos
Reviews.Author: Mohamed Soliman
Reviews.Content: Excellent with Night photos.. Excellent Camera with great technology.. I highly recommend it.. Value for money.. Five stars Canon Camera

Reviews.Title: Very fun to shoot with and takes great pics!
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Bought it as a backup to my DSLR or as an alternative and I'm using this camera more often than the other.  It takes some great pics and the manual mode is set up very nicely.  Overall, great pocket cam.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: maureen
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and figure out. Make sure you have a back up battery though, as the battery seems to need charged more frequently than my comparable cameras.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Motivator
Reviews.Content: This may be all the camera the average photographer needs. It is a small compact well made camera. From face reconnition to GPS, auto everything or manual, not to mention great photos. See this site for a thorough discription: [...]

Reviews.Title: Performs as well as expected
Reviews.Author: Theuns Verwoerd
Reviews.Content: Overall I'm mostly happy - it works with only minor usability niggles, ISO6400 is usable, and optical quality is quite good.  Battery life is weak, as expected.Bear in mind that, as a video camera, it's not great - it'll randomly stop recording after around 22 min, and at best recording times are limited to less than 30min.  Unlike my FT1, you can't set this camera up to record an event without a minder - it's ok for clips, but that's it.  Battery life for taking video is around 82 minutes.  (Also, video ISO is limited to 1600.)

Reviews.Title: Best Pocket Camera I've Used
Reviews.Author: R. D. Collins
Reviews.Content: LOVE this little camera. Fits in my pocket, has a great zoom range, and takes very sharp photos with pleasing colors. Very easy to use with lots of options for both the total newbie and the experienced photographer.

Reviews.Title: Great Compact "DSLR"
Reviews.Author: David Hwang
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I still use my DSLR when I want sharp pictures that I can only get with real optics, but this compact has redeemed the class for me. I was recommended this camera by several professional photographers and I am not disappointed. The manual mode delivers, and the RAW images are a big advantage. The compact size allows me to carry around easily and to take shots that I would otherwise look obnoxious with a full size DSLR.The ISO performance is some of the best in its class, and the price is on point. I'm glad I pulled the trigger on this and would definitely recommend it to other photographer hobbyists used to the features of a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot S100
Reviews.Author: Sharra Wilson
Reviews.Content: I love the compact size and extra features available! I also like that I have the option to video as well.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for the size
Reviews.Author: Jorge Luis Alvarez
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small camera with good photo and video quality, this is it.The good:SmallGood photo and video qualityA lot of features including HDRGood and fast pictures in the darkThe bad:Battery life could be better. (I recommend to bay a second battery)Flash pop up: the flash pops up where we usually put our finger. (will be good to have it at the middle of the camera instead of left)Good product

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Steve Kish
Reviews.Content: I had to get used to not having a viewfinder, not gripping the top left corner (where the flash pops up), and the GPS can take awhile to get the position locked, but overall I'm happy with the performance and quality of photos as well as the build of the camera.  Having the photos geo-tagged is really convenient, and its fun making slow-motion videos.  1080p HD videos can be memory hungry (a 7min video used 900MB).  Videos and flash also use up the battery quickly, so I'd recommend getting at least a 16GB class 10 memory card and a 2nd battery to make sure you get though the day.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Michelle Bradac
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a smaller point and shoot with manual settings and so far I love it! It has the versatility I was looking for but also has great auto settings. I am a fairly novice photographer so I did have to read the manual to figure out the manual settings but once I figured them out it has been a really great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera
Reviews.Author: J. P. Dodson "Photographer"
Reviews.Content: I shoot Nikon for my DSLR's, but the S100 is the best handing compact I've owned. If you are a serious shooter and need to be able to change settings quickly this is your compact camera. Stellar image quality from its small sensor, it's the perfect carry camera to have at all times.

Reviews.Title: DOES THE JOB
Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Tucker
Reviews.Content: This little jewel lives up to the recommendations of my photography friends for a beginning camera for my wife. It does everything she wants in a first class fashion.

Reviews.Title: Increíble
Reviews.Author: Juan Felipe
Reviews.Content: I was reviewing the suggestions about this camera, but it is outstanding. Thanks everything arrived  as the description. P.D. I tested the camera at night conditions and it works perfect.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Point shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Vishal Bhatia
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Point shoot camera , meets all the the need of camera, if somebody just want to use for family pictures it is right choice

Reviews.Title: Lens retraction failure.  Canon fixed for Free
Reviews.Author: _LARS_
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera, but I experienced the same problem that other folks are reporting. It worked great for a while (in particular taking great photos at low light), but after only a few months the lens cover stopped retracting. I've treated the camera gently and kept it in a camera case when not in use. I'd expect a camera of this quality to last longer.Canon has acknowledged the issue on-line, but not for all serial numbers (mine is outside the range of cameras that they list). I sent them an email, described the problem and they asked me to mail them the camera.In about a week they fixed it and sent it back to me - free of charge.  Thus far, it seems to work just fine.  Fortunately, I purchased it just under a year ago, otherwise it looks like the repair may not have been covered.Giving it a one-star, primarily so folks are aware of the problem.  However, before it broke and once fixed, this is a fantastic camera.  Awesome zoom and amazing low light photos.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Ivey
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera, a bit smaller than the SD90 and heavier. Pretty much same settings... but I liked the SD 90 better, which is what I had for years before breaking it. The reviews say that the S100 has a "Sunset setting" but this is not correct. On 'Auto' it will at times but it is not a setting you can choose under scene. So I returned it and bought another SD90.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: AYM
Reviews.Content: I bought the black one at price $279.99. If you are looking for a point-and-shoot camera, I don't think you will find a better one at this price. S100 has a larger sensor (1/1.7) as compared to majority of point-and-shoots (1/2.3). It captures a rich and deep color set. Good enough at low-light conditions, has a good manual control, has a built-in HDR, not the best one, but anyway, it does have, and also supports RAW image format. So in general, I consider this a great purchase. Before this one , I owned canon A630, which was I think even better, though an older model, but I dropped it one day, and some functions did not work properly. After a long research I found s100 to be most promising camera under $300, and I do not regret. The only drawback that I've seen yet is the short flash range, anyway it is not a problem for me, as I try to avoid using flash at all. Hope this helps.I am updating my review after some 3 months with a negative impression: everything is still good, but not great. The images are distorted at the edges, sometimes more, sometimes less, but now I try to keep people near to center, so that the photos do not appear as in the curved mirror. Changed the rating from 5 to 4.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Erik Hendrickson
Reviews.Content: This line has always been solid.  I had been considering a used S95, but when the S100 went on sale, I couldn't resist.  I'm a semi-professional photographer, so while I have many other cameras, this is the one that stays with me.

Reviews.Title: S100 vs RX100
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: Last October I started looking for a new point and shoot. My old camera was a Canon A620. Its about 6 years old and been a great first digital camera for a beginner. I was thinking this time getting something nice a little more top of line. So I spent a lot of time reading and watching reviews. The RX100 had only been out a few months. All I heard were rave reviews about. So I bought my first $650 camera. When it came in I was kind of impressed. It was really high quality and small. So small and expensive I noticed my fingers hurting from holding it so tight. While trying to learn all of its functions. The first day after handling the RX100 I did not like it. Because it was so uncomfortable to hold for me. The edges were not rounded like most cameras. It had more of a square sharp edge. But after a while I got use to holding it and it became a little more comfortable.I ended up returning the RX100 in less than a month of owning it. Do to it draining the battery for no reason when not in use. 2 times while owning the camera it drained a full charged battery.I am just a novice when it comes to cameras. But honestly I felt my old A620 took better pics for me than the RX100. Which makes no since to me. I am glad I got rid of RX100.The Canon S100 right out of the box. I liked it a lot more than I did the RX100. It is so much more comfortable to hold with its nice round edges. I love this camera. I never felt that way about the RX100. Also I bought the S100 for 1/3 of the price of the RX100. Saved so much I bought the 2 year square insurance with it.Pros: super comfortable, shoots amazing pics.Cons: I see some say they don't like the S100 because it is plastic. But to me it seems like a super plastic. Kind of like a glock plastic. Seems tough to me. I would not call that a draw back. Only 2 cons I see so far. Recording video. There is a little a noise recorded when you use the zoom while recording. But not bad. And battery life could be problem.Recommendation if you buy the S100. Purchase a spare battery. They are cheap $13.Personal Con: I don't like the GPS. I know it can be turned off. But I don't trust there are not back doors into it. Just like cell phones were illegally spied on with out warrants. The gov said it was because 9/11 it started. But then we found out they had been listen to us since the 90's way before 9/11...  Anyways my 2sents.So far lovin this camera...

Reviews.Title: Great price for a super camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin L Stiverson
Reviews.Content: Great price for a super camera.  The ability to shoot raw mode is what takes this camera to a level above most others.  I know there are newer models and different brands that are better, but for a person looking to get real quality for an entry level price, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Robbie Bobagov "wicked good analyst"
Reviews.Content: In purely technical terms, this camera has about 25% - 35% of the capability of my Canon 5Dii. Still, the best camera is the one you actully have with you, and if you're going places where you don't want to lug around a lot of weight, like my recent trip to the Carribean, the S100 is really a fun choice.  Because it is smaller and not as intimidating as the 5Dii, the S100 can actually be better for taking candid shots of people. The shutter lag, however, can be bit problematic for capturing that 'definitive moment.' If you're on an extended trip, be sure to take an extra couple of batteries and, to conserve power, turn off the GPS.

Reviews.Title: Good low-light capability
Reviews.Author: Scott Linn
Reviews.Content: This camera is really nice, and the low-light sensitivity is very good.  Used it recently in Belize & Guatemala to take photos in dark forest and once I got the hang of adjusting the ISO level it worked very well.

Reviews.Title: Used for video
Reviews.Author: Chris M. "Chris"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to film my golf team player's swings and the 240 fps video mode does a great job. I am still working on the focal length ring and other settings, but it has satisfied my expectations for that. The GPS feature has not been very good, but it may be user error. I think it would be a great walk around camera for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: Great Replacement for my S 90
Reviews.Author: Murray G. Saunders
Reviews.Content: Am quite satisfied with the performance of this camera and it's ease of use. Pictures are clear and well pronounced. Was skeptical after reading some reviews of "lens error" problems but was relieved when I started using the camera. Great for travel and easy to carry. Plus the full array of manual settings.

Reviews.Title: Great quality, easy to use
Reviews.Author: Rory Lalor-Molero
Reviews.Content: Each time I use this camera im surprised at how easy it is to use, and the quality of pictures and video it takes.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Eduardo F. Amaral
Reviews.Content: I am impressed with the quality of photos shot at night time with no flash. Excellent! But keep the GPS off, otherwise the battery will end up really fast

Reviews.Title: not a pro, but am an advanced user
Reviews.Author: Lance Y
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my need for a dslr.  I had been contemplating a dslr for a long time, but I didn't want to get sucked into the whole lens craze.  Needing one for each and every occasion.  I know this was a compromise, but I am very happy with it.  I'm not gonna say it's even close to a dslr with a prime, but this is a tool that shines for what it was designed for... being there when you need it.  I can say that I can bring this to any event and not be "that guy".  People act differently when you shove a lens in their face, but with a p&s;, things are natural.  It takes pretty good (don't pixel peep) pics in all sorts of light.  So guess what?  I'm done thinking about cameras for now.  Mission accomplished!  (Ghost Protocol not "W")

Reviews.Title: great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: MrKen "Mister Ken"
Reviews.Content: When it first came out, I bought the S95, which I still have and use for work.  But then Canon announced the S100 and I wanted it for the wider and longer lens and newer image processor.  Then came the S110, which to me was not an improvement.  I saw one in the store and it looked cheap.  So I grabbed an S100 for $279.  I've taken it to New Zealand on vacation and was more than pleased with the pictures it got.  I also had my Lumix DMC-GX1 with 3 lenses, but within its zoom range, the S100 was just as good.

Reviews.Title: Canon S100
Reviews.Author: Iron
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera. Over expectations. Amazing images and films, and software that allows several possibilities and remarkable features.I recommend if you like compact cameras

Reviews.Title: Malfunction within 9 months of purchase
Reviews.Author: slm
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this camera until 9 months after buying it there was a lens malfunction. Now, it's on my dime to send it back to Canon for the fix and I'll be without a camera for weeks. This with a newborn. NOT happy.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little point and shoot
Reviews.Author: francine fischl
Reviews.Content: I am extremely pleased with this little camera and so far, have not missed lugging my big camera and lenses around.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good, but not my favorite
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: Battery Life: I was disappointed in the battery life of the S100, even with the GPS turned off. Maybe it was the "on-board help" that was to blame, but I had taken only 75 photos and one short 2 minute video before I got the initial low battery signal.  I think the low battery signal showed up a little premature, as I was able to shoot 30 to 40 more photos before it needed a recharge (I still consider this bad since it's rated for 200 photos).Build Quality: My camera came from Japan. Loved the matte black finish, didn't feel like it would slip out of my hands.Photo Quality:  Great. Bright colors....great photos of my pets.User Interface:  Typical Canon, settings on the left side and across the bottom. To most people it seems uncomplicated; to me, I started out with Panasonic and Fuji cameras and those are easier. Maybe it's just what you start out with always seems the easiest. At least this has on-screen help.  Has full manual control so you can grow into this camera if you know nothing starting out.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Angel E. Valentin "Photographer"
Reviews.Content: I loved my S100 for the time I had it. I'm a pro photog and needed a carry all the time camera. It actually performs very well even @ 1600 ISO. I owned each S model from the S90 to this one. I only sold it to get a Lumix LX7 which I like a lot more but is not as compact as this one. I woulda kept both if I didn't need the money to pay for the LX7.

Reviews.Title: Really good, but not great
Reviews.Author: MarkS "MarkS"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this camera.  I love the GPS feature, which is not often found on cameras.  I kept hearing about the Sony RX100, but at more than double the price of this camera, I just wasn't sure.  Well, after having both in my hands and testing them out, I had to conclude that the Sony took better pictures.  Ultimately, that is what matters most.  This camera felt sort of cheap after handling the Sony for a while.  I will say that the menus are easier to navigate on the Canon, though.  The Sony does a much better job in low light conditions as well.  However, if you don't have the money to spend, this Canon is a close second.

Reviews.Title: Canon makes the best!!
Reviews.Author: James Hayden "Tell us about yourself!"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great!!  I can't say enough good things about the camera and the software.  This camera is realiable and just great.  Any camera from Canon is great and this S100 replaced an old Canon that we had for many, many years.  Buy, you'll love it.  Easy to use, easy to share and easy to transfer pictures with the software.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: LINDA
Reviews.Content: just received the camera and love it. so many options and fun features and have taken alot of fun pictures already!!!!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I normally don't purchase point and clicks, but this a fantastic camera.  I purchased this for my wife because the auto programming produces great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Buyer
Reviews.Content: This is a great travel camera.  It has taken place of my heavy, bulky 35mm digital camera whenever I am on the road.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Rui Peixoto
Reviews.Content: Great little camera! I really like how the interface is setup. It's actually nice to use it in manual mode.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Fatima
Reviews.Content: Love this camera!! Love the style the color the quality of the pics also the fact that I look amazing in all the pics!!

Reviews.Title: What a great value!
Reviews.Author: texag2014
Reviews.Content: I'm a college student on a budget, but I still wanted something that would help my preserve the memories. I found the Canon Powershot S100, and I could not be happier! For only around $300 you will get a feature packed camera that takes beautiful clear photos. I highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a simple point and shoot that takes high quality photographs.

Reviews.Title: Canon S100 a great little camera.
Reviews.Author: Kenneth L. Cuneo
Reviews.Content: The canon s100 is the camera that I have been waiting for.  It's a small auto pocket camera when you want it ti be, but it has the capabilities and controls of a SLR when wanted.Great price on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the price
Reviews.Author: VAO
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. The quality of pictures if better than any other digital camera I have owned. Also, it does HDR images so I was able to take amazing pictures of fireworks which I have not been able to take with my SLR. Also, the quality of videos is top notch.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Roy H
Reviews.Content: I have owned lots of cameras in my life including dozens of digital cameras. If I had to have one camera only, I would probably choose the S100. I usually have a pocket point and shoot with me most of the time, and this replaced a Canon SD780 that I have used for almost 4 years. The S100 is a little bigger but it does so much more. The last small camera I owned with optional manual controls was the Canon S80 and it was 3 time thicker and not very pocketable. This camera has more features than most people would use or even know how to use, therefore it's not a good choice if you are just going to point and shoot for the Kodak moment shots. The extra range of the optical zoom is well appreciated also. Low level light is less of a problem because of the higher ISO range. So, if you want to spend this much on a small camera and you will use the extra features, this is the camera to have.

Reviews.Title: Very good overall, beware of focus clicking noise
Reviews.Author: Detroit4ever
Reviews.Content: This camera is very, very good.  The image quality is the best I've seen in a point & shoot.  The is nearly no noise even at ISO 3200.  Plenty of manual options.  The main reason I bought this was for its reported video quality, especially it's reported low light quality.  It is very good but there can be some blocking/artifacting in dark areas and shadows.  The biggest problem with this camera is the damn clicking sound it makes when the auto-focus is adjusting!!!  If it wasn't for this issue this camera would be a 5 star +++.  Perhaps a firmware update will eventually fix this issue.UPDATE:During Video Mode-THE CLICKING NOISE during what I presume is the Auto-Focus is SO ANNOYING.  The camera defaults to Auto everything during video mode.  It would be nice to have some control over ISO during recording.  I'm glad I got this camera for only $250!  I don't think it's worth $300+Still Images:Still images are good.  Sometimes, even in bright light, it's hard to get a fast enough shutter speed to avoid blurs.  Low Light image noise is very minimal, by far some of the best images from a point-and-shoot in low light.

Reviews.Title: good camera, but has some issues
Reviews.Author: hxh
Reviews.Content: camera is great - I like the extra lens ring and the image quality is top-notch. quality of the camera itself is great, the matted black is great and a lot of people have made comments on this.but it is annoying for most people - mainly because of the flash. The flash pops up right where most people put their finger...I don't mind it myself, but when I give it to other people, it is always a hassle. It is annoying have to tell people to put their finger somewhere else, especially when you need flash.Got this for $250, which is fair price, but could not deal with the flash.

Reviews.Title: Great low-light camera that fits in your pocket
Reviews.Author: Carol and David Melvin "Technophile"
Reviews.Content: There are amazing full-size sensor cameras out now from Sony and from Canon, but this is STILL a great camera, and a great value.  While a digital SLR still rules for photo quality, it won't fit in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Impressed every time I take a picture.
Reviews.Author: Amy & Jacob
Reviews.Content: I got this camera after selling a bulky Nikon DSLR. I wanted something with good picture quality and pocket-sized. I have to say that I am impressed by every photo. My husband and I will take a photo, glance down at the preview and just say, "Wow". The photos are bright and crisp. The camera itself feels great to hold, feels expensive and works great. I am so glad I got this camera, its perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: Nice true point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted a true point and shoot that I could slip into a pocket when snow skiing.  The camera was easy to use after reading all the directions.  As other reviewers have commented - the flash is precisely where one naturally holds the camera so anyone using it almost always blocks it when it tries to pop up.  Then you turn camera off and on again.  Not a reason not to buy this camera so long as other features meet your needs.  I like the range of the lense from wide angle to zoom - might not be enough zoom for everyone.  Hard to get more zoom on a camera this size.  I'm very pleased with the photos I took both inside and outdoors.  Have only seen photos on a computer.  I haven't printed any yet.  Camera is ready to shoot relatively quickly after turning it on.  I didn't have any issues with the battery.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Ilona "Lolachka"
Reviews.Content: Compact, powerful and gives a good shot every time. I had the S95 and upgraded to the S100 -- not much difference in the menu options, but still...the camera definitely does not disappoint. Quick shutter speeds, great videos, pics are crisp. Takes a little bit to walk through the menu to understand all the available settings, but that's a one-time learning curve.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera for serious photographers
Reviews.Author: G. Tool
Reviews.Content: This camera was available from Amazon at Christmas time for a great price.  I researched all of the cameras I could find that would act as a point and shoot and also save in RAW format.  This one seemed to be head and shoulders above the others, and with the great price offered was certainly the best value available. I have used it moderately so far and am very pleased.I do have one issue - getting used to the flash location where it can pop up on your finger if you hold it in the most comfortable way. I just leave the flash off until i know I am going to need it and then I'm already forewarned not to hold it so I interfere with the flash.I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Worked great on our vacation in the Philipiines
Reviews.Author: DAVID
Reviews.Content: Took great pictures and videos.  I am so pleased we chose this camera. It stood the test and then some.

Reviews.Title: Incredible
Reviews.Author: shakeim peoples
Reviews.Content: Incredible point and shoot camera. The price here compared to other sites like best buy and newegg can't be beat.Pros:-Pictures are clear and look amazing. Even in high or low lighting.-HD video recording.-I like the ability to manuall control the ISO.-The butons and overall fell of the camera is great. I like the way it feels in my hands.Cons:-So far just the battery life.-You need to buy a second battery.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product - with a recall
Reviews.Author: Peter G. Cook
Reviews.Content: I wanted to step up from a very satisfactory experience with Canon's Powershot S3. Several excellent reviews, including David Pogue's led me in this direction rather than a SLR. The result is an amazingly compact and light camera with a very good lens. It has most of the functions available on very expensive cameras. Shooting RAW postpones a lot of the decision making for post-processing. I highly recommend it for anyone not needing the lens performance and flexibility (and inconvenience) of an SLR.My unit was early production (2011), and on a recent cruise broke down with the lens failing to retract. Canon was very responsive about fixing it; it is in for repairs and I miss having it at hand.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot S100
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: Real nice point and click. Shoots fast, good telephoto. We are not great photographers, but has been great for travel, use it with the Canon underwater housing and it has worked real nice as a dive camera.

Reviews.Title: excellent Non-SLR camera!
Reviews.Author: beansider
Reviews.Content: super portable but produces high-quality photos!! I went to Florida with S100 for holiday and captured many wonderful momentsit‘s perfect for people like me who don't run after big and heavy DSLRs!

Reviews.Title: No regrets
Reviews.Author: nighthawk
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a trip to Germany's Christmas markets, and headed overseas without having used the new camera, so it was a learn-on-the-vacation experience.  I didn't even know where the zoom button was (it's perfectly obvious, of course) or how to view my pictures (which I learned a few days into the trip).  I'd been relying on my smartphone to take pictures for years, and was pleasantly surprised to see how much better the photos from a dedicated camera are.  So my impulse purchase from the Deal of the Day really did turn out to be a "good deal," although I'll confess that I still haven't worked my way through the manual or used all the camera features.

Reviews.Title: Wasn't sure - now I love it!
Reviews.Author: Catlyn "Catlyn"
Reviews.Content: My old Canon S5 IS kicked the bucket, breaking my heart. I loved the zoom and the feel of that camera in my hands. After much research (bascially asking the camera geeks in my life for advice) I kept hearing about this one. The Canon S100. It's small. Like fits-in-your-pocket-with-no-worries small. But it's powerful. After sitting down with my camera guru friend, who showed me just a fraction of the ins and outs of this baby, I was suddenly excited. You can actually manage the strength of the flash. No more washed out ghost faces ... you can take pictures where they look like PEOPLE. And low light is a breeze, making natural looking photos with no blur.  The only disappointment is the zoom, which as my friend said, use your feet and walk forward. :)  I couldn't afford a mega camera with super zoom to replace my old one, but this is seriously all I need for pictures of the people I love in my life. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: great camera. excellent picture quality and pocketability
Reviews.Author: Andy Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take pictures of products, and to bring on trekking trips to complement my large format cameras. So far it serves the purpose very well

Reviews.Title: Nice Point n Shoot
Reviews.Author: Jim K
Reviews.Content: A nice point and shoot pocket size camera.I was looking for something smaller than my DSLRs to carry around. The S100 is a good blend of lens range (24-120mm) and speed. The image quality is better than most all other pocket cameras. I thought the silver color had a less "Pro" look to it and would reflect more heat than the black version. When it was a Black Friday Special I jumped on it.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Sebastian Ebensperger "Atepeye"
Reviews.Content: My best pocket camara to date, grate pictures, great angle (24 mm), perfecto for night shot and videos. Even better than the new S110. Very nice feel and grip. I only wish a longer battery life.

Reviews.Title: GREAT camera!
Reviews.Author: Erica Avila
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this camera as a wedding or birthday gift.  Small and compact, yet does it all!  Fall back- not enough memory though, need to buy the memory stick/disk apart.

Reviews.Title: The Canon Power Shot
Reviews.Author: Laszlo Gazdowicz
Reviews.Content: The camera is a wonerfull thing.It's small and very usefull and also nice to cary even in my pocket.Sometime did pictures wich rival a big camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Matt Child
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to use for the birth of our first baby.  I was very worried about the shutter issues noted in so many reviews, but I checked into it, and was told the issue had been addressed.  The camera came so holy recommended by five professionals I spoke to, I decided to buy the camera.That being said... This is a great camera.  It has plenty of options for me to tinker with, but easy enough for my technophobic wife to just point and shoot.  Great pictures, fast response. easy video as well - my favorite camera I haver ever owned.The only reason it does not get five stars - the battery life.  Buy the extra battery and keep it charged.  It claims 300 pictures for the battery.  I think it is more like half that.  I concede that it is largely connected to the amount of time the screen is on, but the battery life is disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Good carry-around camera
Reviews.Author: PeterB37
Reviews.Content: It's nice and compact, it has a wide-angle zoom reaching out to mild tele, the lens is reasonably fast, it can record in raw and it is now quite reasonably priced. I wish it had a viewfinder like one of its predecessors had (S70?). While it was far from a great viewfinder, at least it allowed you to point the camera in bright sunlight. The screen on the S100 is not useable in bright sun.

Reviews.Title: Comment
Reviews.Author: Shaun Driscoll
Reviews.Content: Outstanding camera in all respects - compact, large screen, outstanding zoom, stability and clarity in all lights, excellent under water (with appropriate case of course)

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Copper
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera, it takes great pictures. The screen on the back of the camera is a great size.  My one complaint is that the flash is in an awkward spot, it pops up right where you would naturally hold the camera to take a picture.  Due to that fact, I am giving this camera a 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Henry M.
Reviews.Content: This camera has all the useful features I need. (I don't need, for example, a wi-fi interface which is available on a newer far more expensive model.) It takes great pictures and is easier to use than earlier Canon point-and-shoot models.

Reviews.Title: A great deal
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: The photos are very clear and with nearly no noise, as good as Nikon D90, except some other functions like focusing, lens. The video recording is also very clear. I can use it as a digital video recorder

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: No complaints so far.The camera is as good as advertised and gives the user a great amount of control compared to other point and shoots. I'm still a relatively novice photographer so I'm finding new things out every time I shoot.It really is a great every day pocket shooter and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: COCONUT GIRL
Reviews.Content: I like the wide angle and zoom. Takes great pictures. Easy to use and the large view screen helps with composing pictures. Can't wait to use it more.

Reviews.Title: Had it for about a month now...
Reviews.Author: Anthony Deal "sbk510"
Reviews.Content: Got my camera and it works perfectly and is a very solid build.  Haven't had the lens error that other reviewers mentioned.  I had to get a 32GB SD card because the one I had (1GB) was getting filled up pretty fast with the HD video.  The microphone for the video is very good.  The picture view has on-screen histograms - RGB and luminosity!  The battery lasts a long time and the wall-unit recharger is much more convenient than AA batteries all the time.  The manual is very comprehensive.  I haven't noticed the GPS working yet, but maybe that's because it doesn't locate inside buildings?  I'm pleased with the purchase and would buy again and have recommended to friends already!

Reviews.Title: Best digital camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Alain Savoie
Reviews.Content: I paid $239 for the Canon S100. It's a steal and for that price I bought 2. I'm an underwater photographer and with the proper flash I get pictures that are stunning. There is a few others digital camera as good or a little better but never at this price!!!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Antonio Vargas y Vargas
Reviews.Content: It has a fine optics and electronic elements to take amazing pictures with no need of flash in low light conditions.Easy to use in automatic mode and even with additional features for those who like to play with a fine gadget.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: warhammerjunkeee
Reviews.Content: I own the Canon S95 and purchased this model for my mother. It has all the features of the S95 that I like (RAW format shooting, Usable Manual mode & dials that allow adjusting of ISO/F-Stop easily)The only con I have so far is battery life, the GPS feature seems to really eat away at the battery life so unless you're using it for hiking or geo-caching I'd leave it off as it significantly affects battery life.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: T. J. Irvine
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera. Solid build and great photos. I have taken about 800 photos so far and almost all of them are keepers. I am still going through the 200 plus page manual and learning new things all the time on what more this can do. Incredible features and quality, I am super impressed. Overall reviews are lower because of the lens error but I got this at a price I felt was worth the risk. My serial number is outside the range of those with the issues so hopefully this will give me years of service. Couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: P. Sarod
Reviews.Content: Fast shipping, the camera is easy to use and the pictures are super clear, there are also many effects to explore, the camera was very worth the price!

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: E. Shen
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my mom during Gold Box deal.  Haven't had any issues so far although we've only used it for a few days.  I have an S95 also and the pics are pretty equivalent.  Easier to hold than the S95.

Reviews.Title: terrific camera
Reviews.Author: Alana C. O'Brien
Reviews.Content: Canon has done it again, this camera is responsive and lightweight and the photos are so clear and focused.  I love the portrait setting.

Reviews.Title: Wide angle HD video is nice
Reviews.Author: NewsInsider
Reviews.Content: This camera is the nicest compact I've used. My favorite features are the wide angle lens, 1-touch video, low light detail, and the in-camera HDR. I haven't gotten the GPS feature working, I'm not sure how to retrieve that data. Good upgrade from SX100.

Reviews.Title: Worth it!
Reviews.Author: Ghost Writer
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take along on a vacation and I'm glad I did.  I didn't want to tote an SLR along and this camera did a stellar job.  I stuffed it in my pocket when I left the hotel in the morning and went on beach walks, hikes, toured cathedrals and museums, and went to restaurants and it handled it all.  The F2.0 lens allowed me to take photos in cathedrals in natural light where flashes weren't allowed and in darkly lit restaurants.  Outside, daytime photos were beautiful.  Put it on a tripod or flat surface and use the self-timer to get in the picture.  I took a few movies too just for fun, but a dedicated vidcam would be a better choice for that.I also got this and it worked well for me:Case Logic TBC-302 FFP Compact Camera Case (Black)

Reviews.Title: A good camera
Reviews.Author: L. Fu "live to learn"
Reviews.Content: it has all the functions I am looking for. I will recomment it to my friends and family who love to take quality photos and videos.

Reviews.Title: This little camera is amazing!
Reviews.Author: James T. Owens
Reviews.Content: This little camera has amazing features wrapped up in a tiny package you can carry in your pocket. I particularly like the low light night scenes feature. I look forward to learning to use all of its many options.

Reviews.Title: Canon s100
Reviews.Author: kirk wilson
Reviews.Content: Great camera, excellent pictures and videos,  this camera has lived up to all my expectations.Highly recommended if you are in the market for a new point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: Raene
Reviews.Content: it looks better than the picture, very cute and handy. the service is good, it arrived at on time. :)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Blackman
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a small camera that takes amazing photos -- this is the camera. Also takes great video. Really just a great product overall.

Reviews.Title: canon Power Shot S100
Reviews.Author: john c. carter
Reviews.Content: it is all that is promised!  now there is no reason not to have a decent camera with you all the time.

Reviews.Title: Caveat Emptor - Time Will Tell
Reviews.Author: HISC
Reviews.Content: I traded in my Canon Powershot S95 (which I loved) to upgrade to the S100, which I thought would give me improved low-light photos as well as other features. It actually did that but then came the dreaded "lens error " problem in mid-July; my camera is in the 32xxxx series, so it is one of the affected ones.  After talking with a Canon tech, I sent the camera to them courtesy a prepaid label (I appreciated that), and they verified that the camera had the documented lens error, made repairs, and sent it back in about 3 weeks. All was well until 3 days ago (December 23) when the lens error began again without warning. I've communicated with Canon who has agreed again to send a prepaid label for me to send it to their repair facility. We'll see what they do with it (and I'll update this review) but right now I'd warn anyone who is thinking of getting this camera to stay away from it, despite its attractive price. After using Canon cameras for many years I have had my confidence shaken. Even if the camera is repaired, I won't feel as though I could depend on it to perform.ETA 13 Jan 2013: received my S100 back from Canon's factory repair facility about 10 days after sending it in. They fixed a torn fpc & confirmed all camera functions. I've given one more star to this product primarily because of Canon's willingness to make the fix a second time, at no cost to me, which I appreciate. Now, I'd like to get at least one more year of use from this camera WITHOUT any problems!

Reviews.Title: good compact camera
Reviews.Author: Robert  Benson
Reviews.Content: I wanted to have a camera with me at times when my full DSLRs were not handy to carry, and this point and shoot fits the bill. It is small enough to fit in a pocket, but delivers very good images and has the capability to shoot camera raw. A lot of good features for a camera of this size and price. (Got it at Amazon with a recent one day $100 off price tag.)

Reviews.Title: Filling the bill
Reviews.Author: E. Rood
Reviews.Content: Better than the S95, don't need the WiFi of the S110? The S100 fits nicely in between. Offers great performance for the price.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Dennis Roodman
Reviews.Content: The camera feels great in my hand.  Not a plastic case, but solid.  The pop up flash takes a little getting used to, I kept putting my finger over the pop up.  Takes great pictures and has easy to use settings.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: CS
Reviews.Content: We had an older Canon Powershot S410 that served us well the past 8 years, but was slow & difficult to take pics while in motion.  This new camera is much faster & does better in dimly lit areas.  The functions are similar & user friendly.  We are very pleased with our puchase & highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price!
Reviews.Author: Lisabez
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shoot camera! Great size to take anywhere, plenty of cool settings but I leave it in auto most if the time because its just that good.

Reviews.Title: http://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/d/B005MTME3U/ref=aw_cr_item_title
Reviews.Author: vermontee
Reviews.Content: So very happy with this camera. I bought it for concerts and the need for a camera for low lighting. Its perfect. If you go to events like concerts this is the camera. It takes top quality photos for all occasions. I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: dck
Reviews.Content: I have found this camera easy to use, including changing various settings.  Although I have only had the camera a short time, I've been impressed with the "auto" results it has delivered in aa variety of different shooting environments, e.g., low light.

Reviews.Title: Canon S100 review
Reviews.Author: sean zhou
Reviews.Content: Very Good and compact. not so expansive, meet my expections, one draw back is it does not offer international warranty.

Reviews.Title: Lives Up To Its Reputation Completely
Reviews.Author: Stephen Moran
Reviews.Content: This Camera Lives Up To Its Reputation Completely!  Very well made, simple to use, and shoots great pictures.  Delivery was fast and efficient.  I would recommend this experience to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Jianfei Zhao
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my 70-year old parents. They love it.I haven't tried it a lot. Based on my limited use, most functions are the same as my PowerShot S95. One big improvement over the S95 is the exterior is or feels metal.

Reviews.Title: Best pocket camera ever
Reviews.Author: justmaxx
Reviews.Content: The Canon S100 is the best pocket digital camera ever made. It has a super-fast f/2 lens, for nice, clean images in any light.I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for intended purpose
Reviews.Author: J. Harley
Reviews.Content: 1/11/13 Update:  The class 10 card dramatically improved perfromance. I'm not sure why it required such a fast card to offer what I consider normal speed but it worked. As soon as I'm finished snapping one picture it's ready for another instantly.  There is no longer a momentary delay while it rights.  Of course, there's always the possibility that the first card might be bad, so I'm going to format it and try it in another camera to be sure.  It was a brand new card and that was the first camera I used it in.  My second comment is regarding the price.  My original review was based on the price at the time. It was well after Black Friday but still around the holidays when I purchased mine.  Now that the camera has been officially discontinued, prices have skyrocketed, by at least $100 most places (where you can still find it). That severly dampens my opinion of the value now because you can get the S110 for basically the same price.  So, if you didn't snatch one of these up during the inventory dump, I'd suggest looking at the S110 instead.  However, if by chance you can find an S100 for the price I mentioned earlier, then by all means, it's a no-brainer.  Buy it!Original Review---------------I bought one the other day because I've always wanted one but just couldn't justify dropping $400 for it. At $250 it's definitely a good buy for what you get. Fast f2.0 lens, large clear and bright LCD, manual controls, RAW capability and full 1080P HD recording to name a few items you get for the price.  Build quality is nice and solid.  The body makes me think of a miniature G12.  It is a bit larger than I expected. It replaced a Canon SD880-IS (which also gave me several years of beautiful photos) and I thought the S100 would be smaller than the SD880 but it's slightly larger.  The controls are well laid out and navigating through features is very easy.  Picture quality so far has been very good under a variety of shooting conditions. Daylight outdoor, indoor under tungsten and natural lighting, and even some candle light shots all came out well.  The image quality isn't going to make me forget I own a DSLR but is definitely very good nonetheless.  It has decent low-light and high-ISO performance but a downside is a softness and tendency to frequently over-expose in full auto.  It can be easily compensated for in manual but if you're a set and forget type, this may not be the best choice for a primary camera.  However, for me personally, I feel comfortable taking this as my primary camera anywhere a zoom is not needed. It's a perfect vacation cam due to the size and versatility.
