I have a couple other minor complaints in addition to the indoor exposure.  One is lag. I have a class 6 card currently inserted and see a little lag between shots. I'm going to swap it with a class 10 card but that shouldn't necessary with this type camera and the type shooting I'm doing (basically all snapshots).  Another complaint is the flash. The position of it, top left, forces me to hold the camera in an awkward manner to avoid obstructing the flash when it pops up automatically.  It's a motorized flash, so obstructing it also raises the fear of possibly breaking it one day.  Other than these minor issues, I love this camera for its intended purpose, my primary go-to camera when I'm looking to travel light but want top notch quality and versatility.  At a price under $250, there is no way I couldn't recommend it.  I compared it to the S110 before purchasing and realized there isn't a ton of difference, especially considering they both use the same processor and are virtually identical spec-wise except a few areas that really don't convince me that the S110 is worth the extra cash.  I can live without a touch screen and built-in wifi.

Reviews.Title: Awesone camera.
Reviews.Author: Tweetyab
Reviews.Content: Great quality, easy to use and exceptional value. Camera takes nice wide angle shots and has many custom features if you want to get even better quality shots  What else can you ask for!

Reviews.Title: No lens error and the S100 is made in Japan
Reviews.Author: Scotford
Reviews.Content: Although this is my first camera I've ever purchased, I'll admit I was hesitant at first because of the infamous "lens error" issue.  Well my silver Canon S100 model number starts with 45 and even after using this several times no error messages or issues.  Spoke to Canon about this and they are aware of this issue, but factory sealed cameras with model numbers (the first two digits) from 45 and above should have no issues with the lens error issue.The Canon Powershot S100 camera is made in Japan but only the camera, compact disk, paperwork and cell in the lithium ion battery are actually made in Japan.  The charger for this Canon camera, the packaging of the battery and strap are made in China.  Not that is anything wrong with that, but I imagine there is some that are interested in that fact.  Another fact I'd like to point out is the milliampere-hour otherwise known as (mAh) is actually 1050, not what Amazon currently lists this as 1150.  That is a slight difference, especially to the person who buys this camera.The picture quality of this camera is exceptional and I take pictures with products with text and sometimes that text is rather small, yet I am still able to take a high quality picture of that item.  Some of these pictures were taken in broad daylight and the quality of the picture was still top notch.For those who are interested, should your charger ever want to repair or otherwise have a interest, to remove the Torx tamper resistant screw, you'll need a Torx tamper resistant drive size seven screwdriver bit or tamper resistant Torx wrench.  Once that screw is removed, all you need a spudger to remove the casing and the internal parts should be accessible.  As a disclaimer, I DON'T suggest this be done unless you absolutely know what your doing and even then I don't recommend doing this at all as this could void your warranty.Overall, this is great camera and if a simple to use, well built and designed camera that is also 12.1 megapixels this is the camera for you.One final note I'd like to add, to store my Canon Powershot S100 camera, I personally use the Leatherworks brand USA made suede leather pouch model number SLMPD.  I am neither advertising nor recommending this item for storage, but if your looking for a alternative means of storage here you go.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera!
Reviews.Author: nuke
Reviews.Content: I purchased this over and above the S110, as it has the GPS feature, which the S110 does not. A wider zoom would have been preferred, but typically wide zooms are at the sacrifice of image quality. A great pocket camera for those interested in the robust feature set akin to a DLSR, including shooting RAW.

Reviews.Title: MAJOR DESIGN ISSUE / CANON QUALITY SUB-PAR
Reviews.Author: IFLYDISNEY
Reviews.Content: I'm a Canon fan.  I usually have noting but positives about their cameras and I upgrade yearly.  Always Canon.As usual I replaced last years Canon S95 with Canon's new S100.  Expecting upgraded enhancements and slightly better picture quality.  Not so...Yes, it would be a very good point & shoot camera if it was available for less than $400.00.I pushed mine towards 1000 shots and most were slow (yes, I used a EXTREME card) but the worst feature is the pop-up flash.  You have to be so careful not to have your hand or finger over that area of the camera.  In fact, I had to disable the flash to cease it.  This isn't only a uncomfortable situation but with your finger or hand over the pop-up flash, it feels as though it is stripping the gears of the flash.It's just fair on colors; slow to focus and slow to process.

Reviews.Title: Really nice camera
Reviews.Author: Older London academic
Reviews.Content: As an owner of the S95 (ie previous model) there was an expectation that this upgrade model would be better and it is.  It handles a broader contrast range without whiteing out and generally performs well under a wider range of photoshoot conditions.  Worth the upgrade for the better quality pictures (and S95 was good).

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality
Reviews.Author: AHD
Reviews.Content: As Richard Wanderman noted in his review ("I have not taken a sharp picture yet with this camera"), I was unable to take a photo (even with the camera set on "Auto" for point-and-shoot photos) that was sharply in focus.  I took the same "Auto" photos with my old Sony CyberShot DSC-W120 and with the new Canon PowerShot S100, and the comparison of the two sets of photos clearly showed that the Sony consistently produced pictures that were in sharp focus while the new Canon S100 did not.  And it didn't matter whether the photos were close-up or long range.There were other things that irritated me about the Canon S100, some of which may have been a matter of becoming used to it but, for instance, on the Sony, it is sufficient to turn the dial to movie mode and depress the shutter to shoot a movie but on the Canon, even when setting the dial to movie mode, one must still press the separate "record button" (and depress the shutter) to shoot a movie.The Canon's handbook (or operating manual) is 236 pages long (on a CD) and it isn't always logically written and compiled, that is, all the information that one might need, e.g., for shooting and downloading a movie, is not presented in one useful place.As others have noted, with the Canon, one must be careful to avoid holding the camera by its top left side, as that is where the flash pops up.Perhaps I had just not learned how to use it correctly but in the Auto mode, the Canon appears to have two choices - flash off or flash on, with the auto function of the camera deciding whether a flash is needed.  In situations where the background is bright (and thus the camera decides that a flash is not needed, even if one points the focus at a darker spot in the foreground), the flash doesn't fire.  Again, on the Sony, there is an option to use a "fill-in" flash, when one wants the foreground to be well-lit.Not withstanding the fact that the Canon S100 is clearly a very sophisticated camera, I felt that it was $429 poorly spent (largely because of the poor Image Quality) and so felt obliged to return the Canon PowerShot S100 to the shop where I had bought it (Best Buy).

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it! Service horrible
Reviews.Author: John T. Gutekanst "Pizza World Champion"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on the recommendation from a guy on NPR. I've had Canons before and didn't like them but did it anyway! I only had it for 8 months and just found out today that the lens will not protract, or go into it's body, then an automatic shutdown message comes on. This led me to google the problem and came to find out that ALOT of people have this problem with this camera. Shame on me for buying Canon again!  ****Now it is 3 weeks later and I sent Canon the camera to be repaired after 4 emails and they sent me an invoice for 170.00!! CAN YOU BELIEVE THAT THEY SAID THE LCD WAS BROKEN. IT WAS NOT! I'VE NEVER BEEN CALLED A LIAR BY A COMPANY BEFORE. HAS THIS HAPPENED TO ANYONE ELSE?

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: TPK
Reviews.Content: This is the second canon powershot that has failed to last more than 6 months. Many people have written about the lens error  problem and I guess it's the same defect in my case. Just absolute pos.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Triode
Reviews.Content: Bought this to take on a 29 city tour of Europe. I was very surprised at how well it worked. Focuses, and auto exposure so fast I learned that I could truly just point and shoot. In churches, and other dimly lit places, it will auto expose and take a better picture than you can see with the naked eye. And will do it quickly.Countless times, didn't think there was enough light and it took a great pic. Very important, since there are so many places you cannot use flash.In a poorly lit Etruscan tomb,  a woman behind me in line, saw the pics as I was taking them when they would flash on the screen for two seconds and asked "How are you doing that? My camera won't do that!"Will easily fit in my pants pocket, or shirt pocket - shirt pocket depends on how sewn, material, etc. but I put it there a lot.Digital cameras continue to improve, and my last one, a canon, was about 300 bucks and three or four years ago.This is so good, that if you had told me how good it was I would have been skeptical and thought you were just in love with your new purchase.Granted, I don't really care about the semi-pro features. I just wanted to enjoy my trip, get a lot of digital memories easily and without hassle. I bought the camera locally three days before I left on the  trip, never did more than quickly read the "quick start" portion of the manual.For what I wanted, it was great and did a surprisingly good job. A couple of times, I had trouble getting a good focus, but this was out of 2900 images. I could probably have overcome that if I had read the manual. If I had borrowed this camera from someone, I would go buy one.The GPS function is great for this sort of trip. 30 cities, in 20 nights tends to blur and be hard to remember which  city you were in.I did a certain amount of research online prior to purchase. Nothing out there at this time, as small as this. Some come close, but just won't slip in your pocket as easily.What a truly pleasant surprise to get something that works this well for point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what you NEED
Reviews.Author: EY
Reviews.Content: I have a dslr and bought this camera (actually, 3 of them: 2 for work, 1 for home) because it's exactly what you NEED: decent sensor, fast lens, great processor, extensive controls (or none at all: just take the picture, dammit!), jpg for quick, clean results and raw for lossless archival. If you're not sure which one, or features, etc. remember the words of Cartier-Bresson "Life is once. Forever." and spend the time saved from searching to actually USING the camera.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy: lens error after 1 week!
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews and knew to be very careful with this camera, but it didn't help.  I got the dreaded "Lens Error" after only a week, in the middle of my vacation.I was just getting the hang of all the controls.  It did take nice photos while it worked, and the lens ring is a nice way to do adjustments.No matter, I returned it to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: WARNING! Avoid the s95 and s100 due to persistent Lens Errors
Reviews.Author: Matthew Taylor
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot S100 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide-Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)I have both an s95 and a s100 (purchased when I got my first lens error on the s95 since repaired.) The lens error also shut down the s100 on summer holidays so I have gone back to the repaired s95 which has just encountered lens error again this morning. A brief trawl of other users reviews will show this to be a very common problem with the design of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little p&s;
Reviews.Author: MICHAEL JOSEPH COHN
Reviews.Content: Excellent subcompact p&s; camera. Full featured including RAW shooting, IS (image stabilization), GPS, etc. Excellent image quality for a camera in this p&s; class.

Reviews.Title: Love it so far
Reviews.Author: cameronbalch
Reviews.Content: I am not entirely sure what all of the negative reviews are about but since I have not shot with the S95 I cannot attest to the quality from that perspective. I absolutely love the camera so far and am extremely pleased with my purchase. There are so many manual adjustments that can be made which is huge for me since I sold my DSLR due to its bulky size. This thing looks and feels great, and has the quality to match.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!
Reviews.Author: C6N
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for two months now, got it from Best Buy. My previous camera was the Panasonic LX5. Great camera but too bulky for me to put in my pocket. My gf has a Canon S90 so I've also been using that for a year.I love this camera. I think it's better than the LX5 in every regard. And it's also better than the S90 although you have to take side by side shots to notice the difference. I'm really surprise to read so many negative reviews about this camera. I had to go back and look at all the pictures I took to see if I missed anything. And yes I still think this camera takes beautiful photos. Maybe they all got theirs from a bad first batch and I just got lucky.Anyways highly recommend if you can find one.

Reviews.Title: Beware of the LENS ERROR!
Reviews.Author: neworchid
Reviews.Content: After using this camera for almost 2 years, we got the dreaded LENS ERROR.  This camera has been well cared for, always in a padded camera bag.  Canon website indicates this affects the following serial nos: "The first and second digits of the camera's serial number are any number from '29' through '41'. "I've called the Canon Customer Service and they confirmed it will be covered under the service recall, but based on the experience of others here, I'm not too optimistic about the outcome.I'll update this post if one repair fixes it for good.  Otherwise, we'll be shopping for a different brand.  I'm really disappointed because I've always believed in the quality of Canon cameras.Update Feb 2014:We did get the camera repaired for free under the service recall; they mailed the camera back for free and it's working fine so far.

Reviews.Title: 'Lens error"  no vacation pictures, thanks Canon
Reviews.Author: Brad Pease
Reviews.Content: I have the camera 8 months, it was great at the beginning, but now it is worthless.  Do not buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot quality camera.
Reviews.Author: Cassandra Costales
Reviews.Content: In general, I love Canon cameras because they are very user friendly. This camera is not only sexy looking but takes amazing quality pictures for its size. I took it on a recent European vacation and I love how its very compact. Get this if you don't want to carry a huge camera but still take nice, decent, artsy pictures. The color quality of the pictures are also very nice and vibrant. I still have yet to use all its other functions...I basically used it on auto the whole time and it was great. I'm not a camera or photo expert but this camera does just fine and I am very happy with it. I think it'll be a while before I buy my next canon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Mike Fahland
Reviews.Content: This is a feature-rich camera that takes excellent photos.  I bought the underwater housing for it and use it for snorkelling and scuba as well as on land.  Videos are also really nice.  Hard to believe all the features built into such a small camera.  Expect to spend some time learning how to use them - it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: dreaded lens error - do not buy
Reviews.Author: J. Cohen "jonc"
Reviews.Content: Purchased at Best Buy (backordered at the time at Amazon).  Camera worked fine for a year until the dreaded lens error came up.  Contacted Canon and sent it in as per instructions.  Got a letter back asking for $160 for repairs.  Not what I had been told on phone.  Called up and they said phone showed evidence of damage.  Absolutely no marks on the outside of the phone.  This is a known defect (my camera fell within the defective serial number range) that can occur with just high temp and humidity.  Canon will not stand behind their product even when it has a known manufacturing deficiency.  I repeat - do not buy.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Power Shot S100 Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Have been using this as a supplemental camera when I do not want to carry around a bigger camera. Good images, takes raw, fits well in pocket.Would reommend. Thre is a newer version of camera that incorporated WiFi.If that is not needed this remains a very good camera

Reviews.Title: Easy and perfect
Reviews.Author: Jason Bonnema "Jason B"
Reviews.Content: This camera makes taking quality pictures easy.  It is quick for a digital and the pictures are perfect almost every time and in every situation.  It can take especially good pictures in low light situations without a flash.  I don't need the custom options, but more professional photogs love those features, I'm sure.  For $230, you cannot beat this camera.  Even $250 would be a deal.

Reviews.Title: Best pocket camera, so far.
Reviews.Author: Russeh
Reviews.Content: For the price, the capability you get with this thing is astounding. Unless I am shooting action photography, I really don't miss my DSLR enough to haul it around. I've always got this little thing with me, which means that I am always shooting. For $250, it is probably the greatest bang for the buck in photography right now. Skip the S110 and buy this instead. Leave it on auto or don't, but just read the manual to learn how to use it properly, and leave the GPS off to save battery. The quality photos a skilled photographer can make with this little point and shoot is great. Most of us care more about snapshots of our friends and family than we do about grand landscapes. Most of the friends and family shots take place indoors. An F/2 lens on a pocket camera is a great thing to have.Buy the wasabi battery 2 pack, or five of them, or a few extra overprice Canon extra batteries. This thing tends to juice out batteries quite quickly.

Reviews.Title: I got the lens error today after one year of usage
Reviews.Author: myxjtu
Reviews.Content: I feel Canon no longer produces high quality cameras. I will not buy Canon camera any more. There are many cheap good alternatives.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Eric A. Duran
Reviews.Content: This camera takes fairly good pictures, almost as good as a entry-level DSLR. I was kind of surprised that there was no way to override the flash (only options are no flash or auto) setting, but it works great all the time.Only cons are battery life, which doesn't seem to last long (I haven't time it, but I don't think it will last more than a couple of hours or 150 shots) and the auto-tracking/auto-scene selection sometimes focus/chooses the wrong subject/scene, so it's probably better to manually select the right scene.The "Blink Detect" is kind of lame because it only displays an icon after you've taken the photo. Since I think most people review the shot right there, you'll obviously notice that somebody blinked, so the feature isn't really telling you something that you didn't know already.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for shooting in "raw"
Reviews.Author: Gerald S. Peabody
Reviews.Content: I like to shoot pictures in raw because I do photo editing with Aperture. Canon is a great name in Cameras and this one lives up to their reputation.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: lapulga
Reviews.Content: I Love my new camera- the ease of use makes it such a pleasure to use.  The pictures come out clear and bright and require very little photo editing, if any.

Reviews.Title: Just about perfect compact camera!
Reviews.Author: Ziggy
Reviews.Content: This camera takes excellent pics and the HD movies are outstanding even indoors under ambient light.  While this camera is last year's model it is still a bargain at $229 (was $299 a few weeks ago).  Luckily I purchased as a Daily Deal at $209 in November, which was a steal.  This camera is perfect for the advanced amateur, or for someone who just wants a quality point-and-shoot.

Reviews.Title: All features updated compared to the S95!
Reviews.Author: Melika
Reviews.Content: When Canon revived its PowerShot S range with the S90 in August 2009, it was in acknowledgement of a clear demand from enthusiast photographers for high quality yet pocketable cameras offering extensive manual control. The S95, which followed almost exactly a year later, stuck with much the same formula - a relatively large sensor (at least in compact camera terms), a 28-105mm equivalent zoom lens with a fast F2 maximum aperture at wideangle, and a multi-functional control dial around the lens. But while its successor, the S100, looks much the same again on the outside, it is to all intents and purposes a brand new camera.Crucially, the S100's three key imaging elements are all entirely new. The lens range has been extended wider and longer, to a 24-120mm equivalent 5x zoom; it retains the fast F2 maximum aperture at wideangle but is limited to a rather less-impressive F5.9 at telephoto (an inevitable consequence of the camera's compact dimensions). Secondly the S100 debuts Canon's latest DIGIC 5 image processor, which the company says is six times faster than the previous version, allowing more sophisticated image processing and noise reduction. But perhaps most significantly, the S100's image sensor is a Canon-made 12.1 MP 'high sensitivity' CMOS sensor in the 1/1.7" format (approx 7.5 x 5.5mm); only the second home-grown sensor the company has used in a compact camera after the PowerShot SX1 IS of 2008.Canon says the new sensor employs technology similar to that used in its EOS SLRs, including an on-chip noise cancellation system, and microlenses which cover more of the sensor area to improve its light-gathering characteristics. The company claims that this results in reduced noise and increased dynamic range; the maximum available ISO has accordingly been increased to 6400. A 4-channel readout system also improves the continuous shooting rate, up to 2.3 fps compared to the S95's maximum framerate of 1.9 fps. For real speed freaks there's also a scene mode that can capture 8 frames at an impressive 9.6 fps, but it's limited to JPEG images only, with no manual control.Compared to PowerShot S95 - key differencesThe S100 is in effect a whole new camera compared to the S95; almost every key feature has been upgraded or updated:  24-120mm (equivalent) lens range, F2.0-5.9, built-in neutral density filter  12.1 MP 1/1.7" Canon CMOS sensor  DIGIC 5 image processor  ISO 80-6400  2.3 fps continuous shooting (9.6 fps for 8 frames in High-Speed burst mode)  Full HD (1080p24) movie recording; H.264 compression, MOV format  Optical zoom in movie mode  Super slow motion movie recording (640 x 480 @ 120fps, 320 x 240 @ 240 fps)  Direct movie record button  Built-in GPS unit with image tagging and logger functions

Reviews.Title: Canon S100 Camera
Reviews.Author: MARGARET DEWITT
Reviews.Content: Camera is excellent, however battery did not work. Wouldn't hold charge. Had to spend extra 35 dollars to get new one. Camera must have been sitting on shelf a long time

Reviews.Title: Does the job in low light settings
Reviews.Author: johnwolverine
Reviews.Content: I love this camera a lot, I bought it to replace my s90 that was stolen on vacation.I read that the s95 is better than the s100, but I see no obvious issues while using it and it still takes beautiful pictures, especially at a party setting or club setting with low light setting where I don't want to carry an SLR and my Samsung or iPhone just provides too grainy of a photo from the high ISOPro:1) love the texture of the camera, it's not a smooth plastic, rather it is a matte feel that is a nice upgrade from the s902) low light performance3) adjust the picture as you see fit on the LCD before snapping4) fits in my blazer without an uncomfortable bulge of an extended lenscons:1) not an slr, of course you won't get that kind of quality or zoom that slr users are used to2) flash has mixed results, I prefer not to use it3) price, you'd think technology has improved to the point where this camera should be below US$200, but I bought it because I can't live without it after losing my s90

Reviews.Title: nice picture quality
Reviews.Author: E Burns
Reviews.Content: We're still getting used to the camera but so far we're pretty happy with the quality and speed. We bought this camera mainly for shots of our ever on the move 16 month old son. Again, thanks to the aperture speed, blur is kept to a minimum. I do wish the photos came out a bit warmer but for a point and shoot, can't complain.

Reviews.Title: the best camera ever
Reviews.Author: George kamara
Reviews.Content: take sharp pics always and it is very easy to carry fit right in my pocket. couldn't have been any better

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot camera series on the market today
Reviews.Author: HTV
Reviews.Content: I am a semi-pro fotog, and have used many pro DSLR cameras.  But when tired of carying heavy gears, this S100 point & shoot camera is the only one i need to carry.  If you can save a bit more money, it's worth getting this $230 ( s100 ) camera, and you'll never have to upgrade for another 5-8 years, conservatively.I am a Nikon guy.  I carry only Nikon gears, but have to vote this Canon S100 (S90, S110) as the best p&s; camera i would only carry.Very light, small ( fit in your pants pocket ) and the pix it takes are sharp, even in low light condition the color is very saturated, pleasant.  I own both the S90 and S100 ( S100 has a wider zoom, and 1080p video capabilities over the S90 ) Don't let Megapixel and zoom power be the judge of a camera.  The end result: the picture quality enhanced to the unforgetable moments frozen in time.

Reviews.Title: amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: IIIMik3
Reviews.Content: this camera is miles ahead of any comparable model that came out on the market around the same time. Image quality is FANTASTIC. The IS is wonderful. The control ring is SUPER handy. The build quality is awesome. The 1080 HD video is crispy. the super slo-mo is fun (although can't be done in HD). One little complaint, canon seems to have done away with stop motion video on their current compact digital cameras. I kinda miss that. otherwise, i couldn't ask for anything more from this camera!

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: H. Hom
Reviews.Content: Great pictures!  Good feel and quality build of camera.  Just took it on a weekend trip and found the battery fairly decent.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Toot
Reviews.Content: We had an earlier version and liked it. Am still learning to push the buttons on this one. It is easy and does a great job. Im not sure where the volume control is on the video. Like the size also,  Would purchase again to say the least.

Reviews.Title: It does everything I need
Reviews.Author: Helber Ramos
Reviews.Content: I liked the camera just because it does everything I need. I don't have too much experience to say more things about it.

Reviews.Title: Read the manual
Reviews.Author: Tatianna "CO"
Reviews.Content: My first S100 camera needed to be replaced because all of my photos were soft and needed sharpening. Plus auto focus was having a bit of a hard time focusing, I called canon and they wanted to repair it but I chose to replace it since I only had it two weeks. The photographs on my second camera are excellent even past 100% on Photoshop. I bought this for the RAW capabilities. RAW can only be used in 4:3 aspect ratio. I don't understand that limitation.My one suggestion is read  the manual and play with the camera while doing so. While watching TV, with my laptop on which was needed to read the manual, I took a lot of of photos flash-less indoors. Even at a high ISO noise was limited.In the various modes I took  photos  with the DR on & off and at 200% & 400%, there is a big difference, turned on & off the shadow protection,  ..et ... I wish the zoom was more then it is. I suppose they are saving that for the next update since the technology is available.  The fact that this camera cost a small fortune & the 'big' manual is not included is annoying.  The money lost in customers returning not only this but other cameras because they don't know how to use them most likely outweighs the cost of printing. Do you hear me Canon??? Not everyone owns a ipad, or a kindle, their too broke buying your cameras! ... :)

Reviews.Title: Great camera; here's how to fix a broken screen!
Reviews.Author: R. Thompson "sixseven"
Reviews.Content: I won't try to add to the reviews here, except to say that this remains the King of Truly Pocketable Cameras.My wife loves the one I bought her, but it took a spill.  This cracked the screen, though everything else is perfect.  Frustrated by this, I began looking online.First, there are many videos that detail how to replace the screen on this series of camera.  Here is one good example; though it's for the S95 I believe the disassembly sequence is the same: [...]Second, the part number for the S100 replacement screen is CM1-7245-000.  Canon Parts can be reached at 800-258-0900 or 866-481-2569.The total cost for the screen, with tax and shipping, was under $40.  For me, getting this directly from Canon was a far better deal than attempting to get the right thing from an eBay seller.I hope this helps anyone else who'd suffered the agony of Cracked Screen Syndrome!

Reviews.Title: Great enthusiast camera, don't recommend for P&Shooter;
Reviews.Author: G. Bjork "digicamhelp"
Reviews.Content: I've owned about 30 compact digital cameras and the S100 is, by all means, one of my favorites. I've owned and used it since mid-October, taking well over 2000 shots.After taking time to learn how to make adjustments when using the 24mm/equiv lens, I have to ask myself how I ever lived without a lens with that wide angle. I've taken some of the best inside shots of my family, ever, with the camera.I also like the longer focal length over my S90, and the high ISO performance (assuming I get the settings right for a scene).If you're a full auto mode user, you may be disappointed with the S100, especially if you don't use center (single area) autofocus. Learn to use P Mode and adjust settings (including Custom Color settings) as needed (eg. white balance, ISO, Exposure Compensation, Image Stabilization, saturation, Focus Mode and focus point size, etc). If you're not willing to learn how to tweak some of these settings, save yourself some money and buy a less expensive, real Point and Shoot camera. If you don't like to post-process images, this camera may not be for you either.I take my s100 with me everywhere and it's a worthy companion to my DSLR.Bottom line: if you're a pro or photo enthusiast, the Canon s100 is worthy of your consideration. If you're a die-hard point-and-shooter, look elsewhere.ps: I'm not into video but I've tried it on the s100. It's amazing though, for those who use a dedicated video cam, I'm sure they'll point out weaknesses.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy S100 if you have S95
Reviews.Author: gallup
Reviews.Content: I bought this S100 very early, around Oct 21 @ the local bestbuy. I was quite excited to be the "early bird", yet I soon started to realize that I had made a terrible mistake purchasing it....I took this S100 along with the S95 and T3i for six field trips. Very frankly, I was SOOOOO disappointed with Canon at their inability to compete w/ the Nikon new series. It's quite obvious that Canon released this S100 in a hesitation!On one hand, it has to bring up sth to compete with Nikon, Sony, and other brands. On the other hand, Canon knows for sure that S100 has made so many trade-offs from the very beginning, which makes this camera a very bad choice for people who have been using S95 for quite a time.Here as below are my own experience:Pros - Unlike some people who claimed that the shooting speed is slow, I don't have any problem on this. I think the shooting speed is a bit faster than S95. But this won't make too much difference. Another great things are of course the GPS function and the 1080P video. Honestly, without these two functions, S100 is in NO WAY comparable to S95!!!Cons - Under auto modes, I found it sometimes hard to focus. And sometimes it took almost 5 seconds to focus yet with wrong objects..... So frustrated..... Second, under low light condition, the f/2.0 is not nearly powerful as it was supposed to be compared with S95. The picture I obtained was dark and orange rather than the bright and true-color ones produced by S95. Third, when you use manual settings, the ISO range is limited from 80, which is so unbelievable!! You may check reviews @ other major forums. People are reporting the same thing.... Can't believe this....Anyway, in general, I think S100 is kind of the trade-off product Canon has made. And it is definitely not a good one. It has some fansy functions, but who care??! The quality of the image is vital!!! And at the end of the day, I don't care if I have GPS or 1080P. I want quality of the image!!I just returned my S100 to bestbuy today by the end of their 14-day return policy. It was such an unpleasant experience.....

Reviews.Title: Shutter malfunction
Reviews.Author: D. Bharadwaj "Seattle Flyer"
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to get the Canon S100, having read the positive reviews. It shot good pictures and life was grand. Then out of the blue, on my son's 11th birthday, 3 months after getting the camera, I noticed the automatic shutter cover was not opening fully. Rebooting, removing the battery did not help. The only way it will open all the way is for me to manually slide it out, which I don't want to do since it will likely damage the lens. The camera was always carried in a protective case I invested in and treated with respect so I have no idea what caused this malfunctionI can't return the camera because it's past the return window. Right now it's a $400 paper weight. .Any suggestions would be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: amazing little camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Ludwick
Reviews.Content: I own two Nikon DSLRs and simply wanted a decent pocket sized P&S; digital for those moments when lugging extra equipment just isn't appropriate.  I received this little gem (w/extra battery) yesterday by way of Amazon/Prime and have been thoroughly entertained by what this camera is capable of.  The faster f/2.0 and 24mm wide angle lens are two features that initially attracted me to this camera, both quite impressive.  Manual control is a huge plus.  I found the customizable Control Ring to be very handy and overall camera adjustments intuitive.The battery life, however, leaves much to be desired, though considering all that this camera can do, it's nice to know the charger (w/flip plug) is very compact and travel worthy.  The lack in HDR auto-alignment is a little disappointing, yet I'm sure the AEB set to -2/0/+2 with Photomatix will do just fine.  I don't like using flash but 'if' I absolutely need it, I have flash exposure compensation set to -2/3ev to soften the (harsh) effects.FYI, if anyone is as irritated as I am that for the price of this camera, the only reference to the actual 'Camera User Guide' (236 pages!) is a lousy .pdf file on an enclosed CD, then order a printed & bound hardcopy through Manualsink.com for less than $20.  Nice for quick cross-referencing and identifying Canon icons.  The Menu charts/displays towards the back alone are well worth the price.I'm currently looking into the WP-DC43 underwater housing case for this camera.  :)

Reviews.Title: great  small camera
Reviews.Author: dillwood
Reviews.Content: I ordered the s100 expecting a small camera with manual control that would deliver satisfactory images. My expectations have been met. This is my carry nearly everywhere camera, running, traveling, sitting in a coffee bistro - its close at hand.For photojournalism i use a canon 1Dmk2n, for other images a 5Dmk3, both great cameras, however neither slips into a pocket or small bag.

Reviews.Title: Nice little Camera!!
Reviews.Author: swarna
Reviews.Content: Excellent image quality in day light. Nice image quality in low light. fair to good battery life. Nice zoom. Nice to have little camera, but bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: Critical problem that makes camera unusable
Reviews.Author: John Rafizadeh
Reviews.Content: My Camera broke without provocation after 13 months of occasional use.  Got the dreaded "Lens Error" that makes the camera inoperable.  Previous models to my S100 were recalled for this same reason, but the problem should have been fixed by the time I purchased my camera.  You can google this camera for yourself and see all the complaints with other regarding this same problem.  I sent the camera back to canon for repair but they said it would cost me $172 to fix the problem since it was a month over 12 month warranty.  POOR POOR POOR.  Don't buy.  There are a lot of point and shoots out there take the same quality photos but last a lot longer than a year of occasional use.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: Ryan M. Mccluskey "hokiev4"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera... until the "Lens Error" problem and then you are without a camera. Big let-down from Canon. Was just starting on a trip in Nepal when the camera failed and then that's it. As a frequent traveller it's not possible to send back to Canon for repair. So, money down the drain.Product should have been recalled.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: greenemann
Reviews.Content: First, this model is under a Canon factory recall due to a manufacturing defect.The defect renders it inoperable.I contacted Canon. They confirmed the recall and told me I would have to pay postage to return it.The recall was not disclosed by Amazon which is disappointing.Second, Canon doesn't provide a printed user manual. The manual is supplied in pdf form.This is neither an inexpensive nor an entry level camera.The thought of having to reformat and print the pdf just to have a manual to carry in my camera bag is also a disappointment.Sorry Cannon. Two strikes and you're out. I'm returning it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Pocketable and Versatile Camera
Reviews.Author: Theodore Smith "Born Again Skeptic"
Reviews.Content: In average lighting conditions this camera excels.  However if you are shooting in conditions where there is much contrast between areas in your shot, the camera will tend to blow out the highlights if exposed for darker areas or extremely underexpose areas if the exposure is set for lighter areas; in other words, the dynamic range shown by photographs is really lacking.  My photos on top of Haleakala at sunrise hardly begin to show the range of light and shadow that I could see.  The exposure can be locked by pressing the shutter button halfway down; if you scan around in an automatic exposure mode the camera will show what the shot will look like and when you find what you like you can hold the shutter button down, compose the shot and shoot it.  The shooter has a lot of manual control over the camera which allows for far greater flexibility than a simple point and shoot.  Flash: why did Canon even bother? Very low output....The size of this camera makes it extremely easy to carry around and available for use; for most of the shots I took the results are quite good, but some where there is a lot of extreme between light and dark in the scene such as especially sunrise and sunset are a real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera BUT
Reviews.Author: Neil P. Whyte
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and is simple to use.  Seems tough as we had it in some rainy conditions and it did not bother it at all.My wife used it mostly in europe and she got some great shots. And she is not good with camera's.The BUT is people are right about the battery, if you are not willing to buy a spare battery then passon this camera, would last less then 1/2 and would need a fresh battery. 1 spare was fine for us, the 2batteries would last a good 12-14 hours. 5 stars if longer battery lifeOverall great camera but short battery life. extra battery is cheap I paid like $15

Reviews.Title: Excellent digital P&S;
Reviews.Author: M. Watkins
Reviews.Content: Just used this extensively on a trip.  It is no DSLR, but for a point and shoot it is very good and versatile.  The camera works well on "green" mode, but if you do want to make manual adjustments, the controls are fast to make changes.  Pictures are about the best I have seen from a P&S.;  This is a very nice P&S; digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Poweful compact camera
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Tan
Reviews.Content: Over all quality of the picture is very good, close to DSLR quality (even at low light). Video mode is not bad either (though have not fully tested it yet). Very compact and easy to handle. I love that rough matte feeling the body has and the grip also feels secure. I would recommend this product for all around, everyday camera.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Greg Y
Reviews.Content: The pictures that I have taken with this have turned out great, as one expects from a camera that costs about $400. Image stabilization works really well about 85% of them time. As many have said, the battery life is a bit short but you can get an extra battery or two for $14 each STK's Canon NB-5L NB5L Battery - 1400 mAH for Canon Powershot s100; if you've just spent so much for a camera, then $30 shouldn't be a problem for about 400 extra shots. Also, one 16GB SD card will hold about 4500 shots at the highest resolution JPEG or an hour of 1080P video. I also really liked the finish of this camera on the Black model; it feels like it gives extra grip compared to other cameras.

Reviews.Title: Automatic exposure bracketing
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera a couple of days, but so far I like it fine for what it is.One thing I haven't seen mentioned in other reviews is that it has support for automatically bracketing exposures so that you can process them externally for HDR photography.  The other reviews that I've seen tend talked about the built in HRD process requiring a tripod--but I don't know why you'd do that anyway.  There are way too many adjustments to make an HDR photograph work to do on a camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for an amateur
Reviews.Author: Memo G. "Memo G."
Reviews.Content: I got this camera 4 days ago and have been playing with it since. I'm not an experienced photographer in any aspect, I just bought this camera since it seems to be the best in its class.I did read reviews about it not being up to par in comparison with professional cameras, but I think that is quite unfair since this camera is a point and shoot, not a professional one.The pictures I've taken came out pretty good, I took pictures mostly of my nieces and I got great shots. I also shot some videos and the definition is very high.Update: after 2 weeks of having the camera, I've gotten into the details of it. The ammount of features it has, specially on manual mode, seemed overwhelming to me so I started to read the instruction manual in detail and I've been very happy with the results. I've gotten some great outdoor night shots as well as very good ones using the macro feature.This is the camera I intend to take pictures of my firstborn son/daughter with, so that says a lot about the quality I perceive from it.

Reviews.Title: Problem with the video
Reviews.Author: A
Reviews.Content: This machine suffers from BAD engineering. The video records noises from the auto focus, this sounds like a train entering each of your family videos. Don't buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Hands down the best Canon camera I've owned
Reviews.Author: Claireth
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have had a number of Canon cameras. Between my sister and I, I believe we have had a total of four different models of Canon cameras and the S100 would be the fifth. Personally I loved the Canon Powershot SD990IS but after I lost it in an airport I got the Canon Powershot SD1400IS. I absolutely loved the 990. It was a little big but the quality was great and I loved the turn wheel. The 1400 shot half-decent but still pretty good pictures and the buttons were just okay. My friend broke my 1400 so I bought myself the S100 and I have to say that I AM IN LOVE. Yes, it's a little chunky but not too big. It takes AMAZING pictures! The quality is really sharp and beautiful. The macro mode is phenomenal and I love that it has the turn wheel. Everything about it is just lovely. I would suggest it

Reviews.Title: Beware - shutter release problems
Reviews.Author: bettybond
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera when our 2nd baby was born. It worked fantastically well for about a year and then, suddenly and for no apparent reason, the shutter started to slow. We would hold down the shutter button, the camera would focus, and then it'd take a good 3-5 seconds for the image to be captured.Now, it won't take still photos at all, just video.And our online research shows that quite a few others have had the same issue, most after warranties have expired.We've reached out to Canon about the matter and are waiting to hear back. In the meantime, we dusted off our 5 year-old Sony point-and-shoot.Disappointed but hopeful that Canon will help us find a good solution for what seems to be a product flaw.

Reviews.Title: You sometimes don't get what you pay for...
Reviews.Author: ADifferentView "charaka"
Reviews.Content: I was looking at getting the S110, but for nearly 3 times the price, I got 90% of the funcationality.  I love the low light settings.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Gisela Baralt "Gisela"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Love that zoom works while taking movies. Excellent picture quality. Need to play with it more to see all the features it has.

Reviews.Title: Blurry images.
Reviews.Author: Richard Runser
Reviews.Content: I Expected "Razor Sharp" images when shown on the computer screen.  These were full images, not small portions zoomed in.  There was definitely a lot more blur in detail than I expected at this price and from Canon which is a top level company.  Using TV, as well as Auto, made no difference.  In case the Image Stabilizer was malfunctioning, two other people took photos, inside with flash and without.  Outside in sunny shadow, and in direct sunlight.For the price it is a fairly good to mediocre buy.  The rest of the camera is great.  If small snapshots with some blurring are acceptable, it is a pleasure to use.This S100 is returned to get an exchange.  It seems far fetched for a high quality brand and priced camera to have this problem, and my hope is that this was a slip past quality control.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: B. Hicks
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in late Feb.  I took it on vacation in April and it broke.  It is the known issue of the lens jamming open.  Even though my serial number is higher than the ones they say were affected, it still happened.  I do NOT recommend buying the camera at all.  Canon's customer service is terrible as well.  I doubt I will ever buy another canon product.  When I sent it in for repair they tried to charge me $160 for repair even though it's stated on their website they would repair this camera even if it is out of warranty.  I sent them the invoice to get the charge removed so they will fix this camera.Stay away from this at all costs.  it's just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: My camera
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Perry
Reviews.Content: Have just been trying it out - seeoms to be fine.  Why do you require so many words, doesn't take that long to describe.

Reviews.Title: Perfect point shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Whizzguy
Reviews.Content: this clicks really nice pics, flash intensity is too good, night time photos are really nice due to good flash. Liked it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Boyle Rodricks
Reviews.Content: I have no compliants so far, it seems to take great pictures and has been easy to use so far

Reviews.Title: Good Low-Light Camera
Reviews.Author: Fred Daniel
Reviews.Content: A year ago, I purchased a S95 and was very pleased. This year I purchased the S100 and was also pleased. Both cameras seem to work about the same, with the S95 being a little better in certain photos.

Reviews.Title: The perfect point and shoot for pictures of the kids!
Reviews.Author: S. Gookin
Reviews.Content: I did tons of research before making this purchase and I am very happy with this camera. Many hobby and semi-professional photographers will say that you can't rely on any point and shoot to take great indoor photos of people, so I was afraid I would have to shell out for a DSLR, but decided to give this one a try before pouring a few hundred more dollars into a camera that I would be loathe to carry around. I am thrilled! In addition to wanting a small camera, I also wanted to be able to take indoor photos with no flash, because I hate how flash looks. This camera does that! Now, if my three year old is racing around in the house at night, I won't be able to capture that without flash, but taking "normal" kid photos where they are moving around, but not flying by is possible without flash with this camera (even in completely artificial light). It also has a lot of different "effect" settings that I usually would not bother with, but my husband has found a few that I really like. One unusual thing that this camera has that seems like a waste to me is the barrel zoom. There is no real barrel with this type of camera, so it's awkward to use and it will be wasted on most people since anyone who has used a point and shoot before is used to using the toggle lever to zoom (which this camera also has). It seems like a waste of weight and expense to have this redundant feature, but maybe some people like it. The other con, IMO, is if you use flash, it pops up right where you would be holding the camera. Fortunately, the mechanism seems really strong, so hopefully it won't break even after repeated deployment with one's finger firmly planted on top of it!Like some other reviewers, the first camera I was sent had the "Lens read error," which did not seem to affect the function of the camera. I sent it back and the replacement hasn't had any problems.Overall, I am thrilled with this camera and I don't think I could find another point and shoot that would take such clear indoor photos.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera
Reviews.Author: Gregory Windham
Reviews.Content: Good communication from seller, good prices, prompt shipping, quality product. Perfect little compact camera for my family. The Canon EOS that we have is a better camera, however if it doesn't fit in your pocket, there will be no pictures when you really want them. Good low light capability and picture clarity. Buy a second battery for trips- will use it up quickly.

Reviews.Title: The perfect camera.
Reviews.Author: BP
Reviews.Content: I recently took a trip to the East Coast.  A friend of mine, who happens to be a professional photographer, recommended I buy this camera for the trip.  I could not have been happier.  This camera takes great pictures, both indoors and outdoors.  The zoom lens worked great for those far away shots.  I got some awesome shots.The size is just right.  I have a carrying case that fits on my belt. Not bulky at all.If you're looking for a simple to operate that takes great pictures, this is your camera.I would definitely recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: amazing quality for the size
Reviews.Author: PJ
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this product.  Image quality is excellent, as is the HD video.  Extra manual controls and the ability to shoot jpeg and raw make this camera a real winner.

Reviews.Title: great camera to learn real photography on, and takes great photos!
Reviews.Author: steelteacher
Reviews.Content: I have had an S90 for years. my mom and I also split the cost of an S95 a few years back. I bought this one for my girlfriend since she wants to learn more about photography and her old camera was partially broken already and needed to be replaced - and the price was right since the S110 had just come out. Like its predecessors, it is a powerful, versatile camera on which one can learn the foundations of photography, as well as take some great photographs. the raw setting allows high end post processing, which I don't deal with yet, but I have taken the raw files to high end print labs and the results are great - far better than jpegs. the large aperture allows great low light photography, which is a huge plus. I look at it as a cheap dslr that fits in a pants pocket - doesn't take dslr quality pics, but you can take it places a dslr won't go since it is pocketsize. one day I'll be able to afford a dslr and lenses, etc. until then I'll continue to rock this family of cameras and love it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: Hugh Barrett Flynn
Reviews.Content: I need a camera that is compact yet delivers.  I have the S95 and it is by far the best camera in it's class.  It is fast, great pictures, good video and easy to get great pictures.  My daughter wanted one so I bought her the S100.  I am now jealous.  I took it for a day and snapped the hell out of it.  What an amazing piece of technology.  WOW.  It is super fast.. Takes good pictures and handles extremely well.  I am always investigating new technology and know there are other options for this level of camera, that said, for the compact nature and the quality build and price this camera is a shoe in for most consumers.  I am extremely please with this purchase.  I have taken 1000's of pictures with my S95 and there is no sign that it is letting up.  These are very sturdy cameras.

Reviews.Title: Best Buy
Reviews.Author: Ldybond007
Reviews.Content: I bought this small camera for when I travel and can't take my proffessional equipment and the quality of pictures this camera provides is woth its price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent in nearly all points
Reviews.Author: Christoph Schubert
Reviews.Content: Excellent sharpness of taken pictures.Excellent Features and programs.Possibility to take pictures as RAW files.Value case and value feeling in handLittle bit complicated menue hierarchy.Hidden flash light needs some training for use because flash exit in most cases is hindered by fingers.

Reviews.Title: good enough
Reviews.Author: S.E.M
Reviews.Content: I like it. It's a good handy camera. the focus is good, picture quality and even video quality are better than I thought. However, there are some problems with flash.

Reviews.Title: Decent point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: This was the first I tried before really reading up about sensor size since I was looking for something good in low light yet compact.  I had been a long time fan of Canon, last two were Canon.  The sensor size here is average for point and shoots so is not great in low light, got mostly blurry shots.  I ultimately went with the Sony RX100 which has a bigger sensor but is in a higher price range.

Reviews.Title: Canon S100
Reviews.Author: R. W. Yingst "photobob"
Reviews.Content: Does all that I could ask!  I especially appreciate the fact that I can shoot in RAW and use Manual exposures.

Reviews.Title: Best Pocket Camera . . . Period!!
Reviews.Author: Michael Williams
Reviews.Content: This is the best pocket camera in the world. You may not need a big DSLR after getting one of these. Shoots great in low light without flash, just crank up the iso and its ready. Images are sharp and renders colors extremely well.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant replacement for S95
Reviews.Author: Kenny
Reviews.Content: So. I used to have a Canon S95, until my fat grubby fingers accidentally pressed on the Power button whilst it was in its camera case, so the lens extended and got jammed. They wanted to charge me 200 bucks for a replacement and I was like no0o0o0o0o0oo.ANYWAYS. having had a GREAT experience with the Canon S95 (people shots look absolutely brilliant, low light shots are AMAZING, shots of scenery with rich colors come out looking vibrant and rich. In short ,the S95 was almost a perfect camera), I the S100 was the first camera I looked at and bought.So. Whuddup with the S100?The good:1) GREAT idea to add on the thumb AND finger grip2) Low light shots just look absolutely amazing still. I love it. rich color, good white balance. all's good.3) People shots still look great on auto mode, even in low light4) noise is pretty damn low, until you crank it up to some obscene level, but hey this is a small cam.5) THE SIZE. Honestly, there is just no other camera out there with this size to performance ration. except for the RX100. But that beast is a good 2.5x the price of a s100.The Bad:1) Battery life is uhhhhh okayyy. Granted I don't really give half a hoot about the GPS function so I switched it off (THAT, saves an insane amount of battery btw), But I took approx 260 - 280 pictures, all with Flash (slow synchro). That's decent. In any case if you need more juice, this right here looks like an amazing deal: http://www.amazon.com/Wasabi-Power-Battery-Charger-PowerShot/dp/B0049XEE88/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid;=1356447979&sr;=8-2&keywords;=canon+s100+battery)2) The flash is still positioned in that ANNOYING position. It's just awkward to have that shit pop up suddenly and push your fingers away3) I don't know why, but the focusing in low light is INSANELY slow, even compared to the S95. WHY IS THAT SO o_OOverall? well I love the camera. I really do. It serves my needs perfectly fine, just taking pictures especially in low lighting conditions. If i could change one thing, it would be the slow low-light focusing. ohwell.

Reviews.Title: A solid compact camera
Reviews.Author: Iszan
Reviews.Content: This is one amazing compact camera where it fits into your pocket easily. The ability to use aperture from f/2.0 to f/8.0 as well as images shot up to ISO 1600 are generally clean makes it even more useful especially under low light or indoors.

Reviews.Title: No complaints!
Reviews.Author: nguyen son
Reviews.Content: I read horror stories about this camera, but so far, no complaints! It is better my other camera, the Canon 300HS

Reviews.Title: s100
Reviews.Author: melody long
Reviews.Content: i love how it's so idiot proof, so hardy, and has so many fun modes to play with :)) really appreciate this christmas present!

Reviews.Title: one of the greatest pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Mohammad Taher
Reviews.Content: this is a very handy and small pocket camerapictures are incredible almost gives a nice SLR effectthe raw features is one of the most key featureoperations are quite easy and simple compare to other available in the market

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed
Reviews.Author: Dan Stegman
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera because it was rated high for a real estate camera where we need good lighting and a wide angle.  It is a nice improvement over my Iphone 4S and so far I have just used it like a point and shoot.  The manual settings I'm sure will enhance my pictures when I learn how to use them. I waited for a good price and got it for $225 on Black Friday.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: avigail
Reviews.Content: this camera was recommended by friends. we are very happy with the way pictures came out. best camera we ever had.

Reviews.Title: Compare to LX5&LX7;
Reviews.Author: M. Hsu "Lizard"
Reviews.Content: I had LX5 for almost a year.  I bought both LX7 and S100 when it's on sale.  If you are looking for easy to use, great image quality especially at low light, high ISO environment, S100 is a clear winner.

Reviews.Title: no lens error
Reviews.Author: jon
Reviews.Content: Was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews about lens errors even though the serial number isn't from 21xxxx to 41xxxx.  My serial number was 47xxxx.  Only time will tell if the lens error will pop up sometime in the future, in the meantime, I'm enjoying this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good deal!
Reviews.Author: DINGKANG YE
Reviews.Content: Brought it in Thanksgiving. Cheap for this camera. About 220 dollars. Even though I want to buy a big one, it is still a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Thiel-lover
Reviews.Content: The price I got this item on Black Friday can not ne beat. THe camera workd great and takes pictures that look beautiful.

Reviews.Title: great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Sakotto
Reviews.Content: A very solid point and shoot, the manual control is really nice function.Got it for gf and get to teach her about photography with this camera.the only complaint would be GPS function doesn't really work

Reviews.Title: Great shots
Reviews.Author: Tyler J Kalina
Reviews.Content: I really like to ability to adjust the setting more than a normal compact camera. I adjusted the settings based on somebody's suggested settings and use AV for most of my picture. Then flip over to auto to let other people use it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera but the flash...
Reviews.Author: Nicolas Pedregal
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera. I enjoyed very much this camera. I used for trips, birthday parties, home, street, etc.The way you have to use the function wheel is slighty different from older models. For instance now this camera have an specific button to record movies.It has an amazing function (SCN), that records a movie with all of your prep moments for each photo, and the camera compiles on the fly and you can watch a short movie animating your photos (it is in a lower res but fine)The only con is the built in flash. This a terrible design mistake. If you have your left hand on the flash when it is going to emerge, happens horrible situations. The flash stays in a mid way and doesn't work until you extract manually (!!) and turn off and on again. I used an older model in witch you could even turn off the flash by manually put again inside and turn on taking manually out. Canon need to fix this design error for the future.

Reviews.Title: A Manufacturer lens error with the camera
Reviews.Author: orly
Reviews.Content: i bought the camera om March this year and it broke this week (December) - after 9 month of use.it seems there is a known problem with the camera.From canon site:"It has been confirmed that some PowerShot S100 digital cameras encounter a lens error caused by a disconnected part inside the camera. This announcement conveys the details of the issue and Canon's service policy for affected cameras. "Affected Products:"Some PowerShot S100 Digital Cameras within the following serial number range:　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　The first and second digits of the camera's serial number are any number from "29" through "41". "Solution:"The products with these phenomena will be inspected and repaired free of charge."

Reviews.Title: great camera...but
Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: just wanted to give my opinion to people out there, as the internet is a great search engine. so i wanted to write back and help toothe camera is great for its two functions of taking pictures and recording videos, its dual functions are awesome and less to carry.  I love the pictures in the manual setting, auto is a bit weird.it takes better pictures without flash, when then the camera does use flash, the pictures look a bit yellowish.  Maybe its me, but this is how it looks.I am happy with the camera even though its on the pricier side.  As for the quality of the camera.Battery life is horrible when in video mode, with a full charge battery, you will be lucky if you get 30 mins.  Stock up on amazon, I have 3 batteries to use.I purchase this in 12/10/11, and today the camera froze up and the lens would not retract and also the control ring failed to operate.I sent it back to Canon and they will fix as it under warranty for 1yr.  I suggest everyone make sure this does not happen to you.I believe this is a mfg defect.Good luck

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShotS100
Reviews.Author: Guy M Hickey
Reviews.Content: This cameria takes GREAT photos.  Especially great low light photo opportunities.  I purchased this model because of 1:2.0-5.9 lense. Definitely note a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Hello
Reviews.Content: I am truly impressed with this camera.  While it does not out perform my 7D in terms of low light capability, it does out perform my first DSLR, the original Digital Rebel.  ISO 1600 results from the S100 are quite impressive, especially if you shoot in RAW post process.  ISO 3200 is usable for small prints.Now on to the lens.  I love the wide end of the lens, it is a slightly soft in the corners wide open, but not objectionably so.  28mm and up it is quite sharp at all apertures over the entire frame. I'm happy to say that my camera does not suffer from any lens abnormalities that have been found on review sites.  Hopefully this is a sign Canon has fixed their production issue.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error Prone
Reviews.Author: Laslite "laslite"
Reviews.Content: Great camera but after 6 months of using the camera the camera malfunctioned with a "lens error" which renders the camera unusable. I researched the problem and discovered that is a common occurrence with the S100 for which Canon failed to address as part of a recall. Many have complained of this problem to Canon and you still need to pay to get this camera repaired if its out of warranty.

Reviews.Title: Huge features in my pocket.
Reviews.Author: C. Pultz
Reviews.Content: I'm a camera guy. I had never used a pocket camera that made me happy - until I bough this one. The only drawback I find is the battery life is shorter than I am used to. Not a deal breaker. (Turning off GPS helps.)

Reviews.Title: in way over my head
Reviews.Author: Christian Ed professional
Reviews.Content: I've had several digital cameras and this one is so bewildering I don't even know where to begin. The view screen is so cluttered with data that I can barely see an image through it. The 226 page instruction booklet would baffle an engineer. There must be hundreds of variables to this camera. I bought it on the basis of it taking good images in low light, which it does. But so much gets in the way that I can't imagine getting much satisfaction from it. (NOTE: I spent a good two hours with our neighborhood tekkie and he figured out how to make all the extraneous data disappear from the screen. But don't ask me how he did it.)

Reviews.Title: Fast, but...
Reviews.Author: Bento Pereira
Reviews.Content: I read a lot about this camera before buy it.I wanted a fast, point & shoot, small, wide angle, with good picture camera. I almost got it all.I want a point and shout. I don't want to know photography. I just need a camera to capture what my eyes like to see, and let the camera do the rest. I don't want to wast time to change settings! I have two kids to look after during my trips ;)Having said that, I'm not happy because three things:1 - unacceptable distortion on wide angle. People's faces will be deformed if they are captured close to the last third of the frame;2 - The same old Canon's problem: tendency to overexpose creating pictures brighter than the real life. I find it hard to believe that in this 2012 we don't have technology to do real time HDR (high dynamic range).3 - The auto white balance (WB) does not represent real life. I have to use P mode and create my own WB (wasting time).So, unfortunately this is not a "point & shot", because if you do so, the pictures you will get are different from the landscape you saw: the grass will be less vivid; the sky might by white, and so many other surprises.But can this camera take good pictures? Of course, but not in Auto Mode.So, far from a "point & shot".

Reviews.Title: Outstanding product
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: B&H; was back ordered, so I bought from Amazon. I like this S100 so much that I cancelled the B&H; order I had in for a Canon G1 X and I also put my G12 up for sale on eBay. This camera does nearly everything and its compact size with the Digic 5 processor is a marvel. The technology capability of this black, somewhat heavy packet of cigarettes is hard to comprehend.I'm wondering about my 5D in fact. I guess I need a platform for a higher telescopic capability, and there are times I need an optical or eye level viewfinder, and a larger sensor would be nice, but otherwise, this S100 is a bloody great home run. Very, very glad to have it.Thanks, Canon!

Reviews.Title: Pass on the S series.
Reviews.Author: G. Gardiner
Reviews.Content: While image quality is very good, the camera is at best buggy. If you get the famous "lens error", you will waste a bit of money - maybe 150-200 on a repair and it will break again. Do not let the metal body fool you, this is a very delicate camera and Cannon offers very poor customer service. Cannon suggests in their Product Advisory that the issue is owners in high humidity environments, but do not be fooled, it is a poor design and poor support to correct it.[...]

Reviews.Title: Another victim of their lens retract fault
Reviews.Author: Phillip North "Phil"
Reviews.Content: Canon really need to lift their game. IMO the S100 is not a patch on the picture quality of the S95 I had previously and after several months, the lens now won't retract. I have been reading extensively online and apparently this is happening to heaps of users and everyone is getting really frustrated with it.In the mean time, I purchased a Sony (they now support SD cards!!!) - and for half the price it craps all over the S100 for both picture quality and features.This division of Canon has really lost the plot.  It is a shame because I have 8 spare batteries for it too but I think I will replace it with a Sony.

Reviews.Title: Upgraded myself
Reviews.Author: Bill of RI
Reviews.Content: I owned a great Canon S50 camera, but it was time to upgrade. Being happy with my S50 I got the S100 and I am so pleased. It has been nine years with the old S50 and now I'm enjoying all the new improvements of the S100. This is one great camera and I hope this new one lasts me another nine years. I am very pleased with Canon and my new S100.

Reviews.Title: Best Pocket Camera on the Market Right Now
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I was informed my father had passed away.  I asked if I could take pictures at the funeral and was told that would not be appropriate.  At the time, all I had was my cellphone camera and wanted to remember something about the funeral.  So when everyone left I took a few photos with my cell phone camera which didnt really do a great job.  Another time, I went into a club and had my DSLR.  I was told that I couldnt bring the DSLR in because it was "too professional".  So I thought I needed a camera I could carry around secretly to remember the moments.  This camera seems to fit the bill.It has an F 2.0 lens and Digic V so it is the most capable of all pocket cameras in low light.  Is the picture quality as good as a full sized or APS-C DSLR?  No it isnt as good, however, there are many places you just cant take that DSLR.  This will provide the best pictures possible for a compact camera.

Reviews.Title: Good performance relative to the size.
Reviews.Author: A.N.
Reviews.Content: Pros: easy interface, nice features (HDR, ND Filter, etc), uses standard battery size of other Canon camera models, sturdy construction, quick startup time, works great with the tiltpod camera stand (tiltpod - always-ready micro tripod for compact digital cameras)Cons: a bit on the heavy side, lens ring protrudes making the camera less compact, short battery life, auto-flash a bit temperamental

Reviews.Title: Best travel pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Raphaël Lessinger
Reviews.Content: I have tested the Canon S100 and have to say that it is the best travel camera of this form factor. For everyday use with CMOS BSI high sensitivity Full HD HDR and all other things, the S100 is for photographers who want to get the best image quality on a compact size camera.I wish it had a faster long focal length though.

Reviews.Title: Auto Mode Flash Problem
Reviews.Author: Ming
Reviews.Content: I own a S95 (and a Nikon D300) and I'm buying this camera mainly for mom who wants to upgrade her old camera.I love my S95, so I had great confidence that Canon would deliver a great successor. So, without playing much with the S100 myself, I hand over the camera to my mom, and expect her to be able to take great pictures by herself as I have done with my S95 in my daughter's birthday party -- indoor.First shot, auto mode, flash pops up, click, picture over-exposed. My first though was that my mom's hand must be blocking the exposure light sensor. So, try again. Still over-exposed! Ok, this time I try it myself, over-exposed. Hmmm..., 4 feet away from the subject might be a little too close. OK, try again. 3 meter away, what!!! Over-exposed again! Luckily, I still brings my S95 (wife use) and D300 (I use).Go home. I looked up all settings under auto mode. There is no control for exposure under auto mode. Ok, how about flash? There is red-eye correction and red-eye lamp. The point is, there is no control for flash intensity. I take a snap of my living room. Again, flash pops up and picture over-exposed -- this time, it's at least 3 stops over the correct exposure. I bring out my S95 to compare -- same auto mode settings, flash pops up, click, and picture looks great! I can't believe it! This is the most basic function that must work! Let me try again... in "P" mode everything was default (after a "reset all") -- set to auto flash, half click, flash pops up, full click, flash fired, picture looks great!Ok, so it's at least not a hardware bug in Canon's part -- the flash intensity did not stuck at high, but is that good enough? No way! How can Canon let this basic function slip through quality control?Luckily, Amazon has great return policy. S100 is going back to Canon. I'm eying at Nikon P310 now, anybody?Potential buyers beware!

Reviews.Title: Lens error after 45 days of usage
Reviews.Author: Konstantin Burov
Reviews.Content: I've bought this camera during my travel around South East Asia at Malaysia (KL). It worked just fine for first 6 weeks and then suddenly, with no particular reason, I got the "Lens error" - camera lenses do not retract anymore. It messed up my vacation. I'm very disappointed. Now I'm at Thailand and it turned out that to fix camera I have to go back to Malaysia, otherwise it would take them 30 days and $300 to fix the problem here :( Won't buy a canon camera anymore. Poor warranty service and camera quality.

Reviews.Title: defective
Reviews.Author: Jaxonboy
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as an upgrade to a Canon 850IS.  Main camera is 5d mkII.  Found that S100 took very good movies.  Took good low light pictures.  Colors are good.  In some ways camera is superior to 5d mkii, much lighter, it does do a good job overall as a point and shoot.  Normal problems with little lens and clarity of pictures, poor detail etc.  But the biggest problem is that it stopped working.  On an extended trip overseas, the lens locked in an extended position and there is some kind of lens error.  Bugger.  Now using the old 850IS, but it is not as good as S100.  Took the S100 to Hong Kong Canon repair center, and they said since camera had a US warranty, they couldn't honor the warranty, and it would take 5 days to fix it, if I wanted to pay for it.So, don't know what the deal is, but many copies seem to have this same problem.  I would not buy it again.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Gui
Reviews.Content: This camera is excellent. It makes HD video and this is great. Well done and it worth money. The only problem is that battery runs out quickly.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as Cannon S90
Reviews.Author: K. Briggs "yeshe-lhamo"
Reviews.Content: When I selected a digital camera, I wanted a sophisticated point and shoot with fast focus, good macro and some solid presets (like indoor light, action shot, etc).  I went with the S90 and loved that model, sadly it was misplaced it at a party.  Since the S90 model had by then gone off the market, I went with the S100.I have not been satisfied with this the S100.  In fact, it is probably the *least satisfying digital camera* I have owned (have had Kodak (great), Sony (solid), Nikon (slow), and Cannon S90 (great)).Why?Cons:1.  Broke the first memory card I used in it (sidebar: I was taking a photo of this weird Star Trek dude in Maryland at the time.  Maybe it was the sheer force of dorkiness that caused the memory card to expire).2.  Has GPS turned on by default - you have to opt out3.  Macro setting *never worked* despite a few hours of fiddling with every setting.  It refused to focus.4.  Mode selection system is cumbersome.  After I finally figured it out, it still took forever to configure scene mode and shot selection for each pic.5.  Battery is different size than S90!!!  Yep, toss that extra $60 charger I bought for the S90.6.  Camera gave up the ghost with a "lens error"Cannon has offered to repair this lackluster performer, or else charge me over $200 for its refurbished successor, the S110.I will probably have it repaired, then sell it.  And then, I am going to buy a used S90!!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: Idiosyncracy "Mista Mista"
Reviews.Content: I am am an amatuer, but I love to take photos.My photography usage is Travel pics and everyday shots.I almost never take video.I used to always use a "fixed lens" 1/2" sensor camera (like the cameras you see in the Walmart displays...they look like small DSLR cameras) until I bought a Canon ELPH SD1200 a few years back for it's portability. It's imagery was AWESOME when I 1st bought it, but I think too much time in powdery desert and maybe time in general degraded the sensor. It was never the same after BurningMan. I looked for a quality replacement after the lens recently got scratched from Kuwait sand.If you are looking for a TRUE pocket camera to take normal everyday pics, then buy one of those. They run significantly less than these and they are decent cameras with EXCELLENT portability (smaller than a pack of cigarettes).I bought this Powershot S100 at the same time as a Sony NEX 5N.I did a TON of research and if you want a DSLR quality camera that is "compact", look into the Sony NEX. There are cons to it (like expensive lenses and add-ons), but it is a GREAT camera for the price. I bought mine on sale for 425.00.
